text: On the nose there is more citrus aroma out of the can, more dankness from the tulip. Going down the hatch: medium caramel backbone followed by a brief hint of miso, then grapefruit, pear and melon which are about the same from both vessels. More pine from the can. Bitterness is just right. Cloudy, looks chew but its not and I love the floaties. A little oily but still finishes clean. Differences are subtle, you cant loose either straight from the can or a tulip glass. A lot going on but it all comes together superbly.  A must try and one of the best.

Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, orange, tropical fruit and hops.

Appearance:

Turbid yellow/golden beer with heavy yeast and with a slight off-white/beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, orange and tropical fruit; ends slightly bitter and dry with hops.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. This is especially true for its abv. Lovely sweet flavour full of fruit; with a tat of bitter hops in the finish. The aroma is almost perfect, but the taste is absolutely insane. Great appearance and palate as well.

Can in Seattle. Huge thanks to Prufrockstar for sending these out to me and Andrew. Creamy soft head, hazy grapefruit yellow. Not as hazy as the newfangled ones. Edge of butterscotch to the nose, but otherwise danky fresh green hop cone. Pretty full mouthfeel for the abv. Orange, creamsicle too on nose. Julie says lemons and meadows too. Fairly robust caramel malts underneath, but the gorgeous sweet hops are all over it, and the balance is admirable. This is just plain tasty.

1 pint can from a cooling container in Copenhagen. This one pours a really good looking bright flowong orange cloudy looking body with a medium sized lasting and quite lacing bright whiteish head on the top. Lovely nosed. Fresh hoppy, lots of citrus elements. Citrus peel, grapefruit and clementine. A little peach sweetness, pine and hits of marmalade. Really nice stuff. Oh, this tastes nice. It has a really citrus peely bitter flavor at first. Lots of orangey and grapefruit. Its nice and oily in the mouth and its just about average on the carbonation. Perhaps a tad over. On the bitter side, but who doesnt like that. A delicious hop explosion. 10.06.2017

500ml Can. Yellowish liquid with a decent white head with nice retention, some yeast particles inside the glass as well. Nose is hoppy as F*ck, citrus, pine, grapefruit, floral. Taste is medium bitterness, light sweetness, well balanced malt presence and hops, tasty! The mouthfeel is gorgeous as well, medium body.

Can, sample. Tasted on the 13/05/2017 at MBCC (Copenhagen). Clear pale golden colour with a medium white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, fruity hops, malts and biscuit. Taste is fresh fruity hops, tropical fruits and biscuit. Rounded hoppy finish. Next one please!
Can shared. Pours clearish ochre. Citrus, pine, lemon, grapefruit. Caramel sweet with a lemon grapefruit pithy bitter. Bitterness is strong. Once fade you are left with mandarin sweet. Fantastic.
Can. Aroma of loads of citrus, mango, passionfruit, juicy. Hazy golden with white head. Taste is light bitter and light sweet. Medium+ body, oily smooth feel and tropical sweet finish.

Fascinating brew. Light, little bit hazy golden colour, nice head. Hypnotizing aroma and flavor, both filled with tropical fruits, mango, maracuja, pine, kiwi, peach, papaya, citrousy an juicy. Well balanced with a pleasant malt base. One of the best beers Ive ever tried.
Can @Craigs (Abstrakt tasting). Pours golden, white head. Nose is citrus fruits, hay, big hoppy nose, Taste is citrus fruits, tropical fruits, bitter finish, really good.
backlog ocena przepisana w ramach uzupełnienia profilu. Dla mnie to nie EC tylko West Coast, chmielowy potwór.
Sample at MBCC 2017. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of hops, grapefruit, mango and some lime. Similar taste. Really hoppy with a medium body and bitter finish.

Can at Positive Pie, montpielier, VT. Had side by side with heady topper and this is better. See pic:

Amazing nose, very fresh and citric. Floral and juicy. Medium dry and a killer mouthfeel. Wow.
Sample at MBCC. Pours cloudy light golden. Aroma is hoppy, fruity, Taste is fruity, hops, balanced, smooth.

Aroma: lots of hops with some green onion; Appearance: hazy orange pour with thin white head that lingers; Taste: pungent hops continue; good bite with oniony finish; strongly malty, well balanced; Palate: heavy body with long, bitter finish; Overall: very enjoyable; would get again anytime.
Shared 16 oz. can. Pours a murky orangish-yellow with a white head. Aroma of juicy, fruity hops. Taste is citrus, grapefruit, orange zest, pine. Bitter, juicy finish.

This beer takes Heady out behind the shed, places it squarely underneath the farmers sons basketball hoop, and does a 360 Windmill Two-Handed Slam Jam Thank You Maam on its Head(y). It is the really fucking good shit, and I would like to drink it every day. Extremely fruity pungent hop nose that nevertheless resembles beer rather than the juice masquerading as alcohol stuff thats all the rage these days.

26.05.2017, 1 pint can @ home:
Big bubbly-creamy longlasting head, slightly hazy with some sediments floating around. Aroma is fresh grassy, leafs, hay, lawn, moss, hops, citrus peel, light malts, minerals, flowers, hints of pine needles. Taste is slightly dry concentrated grassy, leafs, moss, flowers, hay, hops, citrus peel, minerals, light malts, pine needles, bark, lawn. Medium to longlasting bitterness, dry grassy mouthfeel. Nice.

Can. Pours a clear yellow with a small white head. Aroma is intense of citra and Mosaic. Huge tropical notes with some slight tartness. Truly spectacular aroma. Taste is lightly bitter which dissappears fairly quickly. Amazingly good IPA overall. Would like a bit more haze and body and head, but damn its good.
Mbcc green. Yellow golden light haze. Fruity, citrus, juicy, pale malty sweety. Med bodied, light green piny, fruity juicy, sweet nice. Juicy nice dipa.

Can at home thanks to Nische! Taste is lots of fresh grapefruits, pine and dark crisp bread. Very zesty and bitter but with some sweetness. In a way a bit too bitter but the body holds up the bitterness very good. A "hop monster" but from someone who understands balance.
From Bierkraft. In Teku glass. After dinner. Really tasty and amazingly smooth, giving it plenty of personality. However, it could have more aroma and less sediments.

Draught at MBCC 2017. High fluffy lasting white head. Clear yellow body. Powerful fruity hoppy straw grass aroma. Dry dusty hoppy fruity straw grass flavor with a high carbonation and a long dry finish.

From a can... just like it says to. Light body. Fruity aroma. Couldnt see if it was cloudy or not. Taste was real nice. Super smooth and very low bitterness. I liked it a lot but it didnt wow me like I thought it would. Maybe pouring it into a glass would help.

16 oz can. Pours a clear golden color and topped by a small off white layer of foam at the head that settles in slowly to a thin film. The aroma shows waves of citrus fruit with notes of orange, grapefruit, mango, and peach to go with a big hit of pine resin and a dry, toasted biscuit malt base. The flavor follows with the citrus coming at you with notes of orange, grapefruit, and mango and some resinous pine to go with a solid toasted biscuit malt base. There is a solid bitterness on the back end along with a nice drying character which I appreciate. Medium bodied and fairly smooth with ample carbonation that leads to a bitter sweet and drying citrus fruit finish. Clean, dry, and firmly bitter. This is damn good ipa, and better than Heady Topper in my opinion.

Can from mikkeller and friends. Slightly unclear yellow with white head. Bright hoppy citrus aroma with grapefruit, hay and some pine needles. Similar taste with a well marked bitterness. Intensely hoppy yet perfectly balanced. Top class.

Can, courtesy of Meilby. Pours golden with an off-white head. Aroma of lime, grapefruit, some orange, physalis , fruitiness and yeast. Flavor is sweet and fruity with some grapefruit, pine, pineapple juice and some bitterness. Medium body, average carbonation.

Can. An unclear orange-colored beer with a small, dense, white head. The aroma is sure like sticking your head into a bag of hops, its piney, grapefruity and resiny on the aroma, with some lime, generic tropical fruits and some physalis. Not much malts, hints of alcohol. Its full-bodied and smooth, semi-dry and with a very nice bitterness. Lots of piney, grapefruity hops and a touch of malts in the flavor. Lasting bitter, hop-driven finish. This is IPA. 170516

Can 473ml @ geokkjer
Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, grapefruit, pineapple, mango, peach, hint of lime and pine. Taste is light to medium sweet and heavy bitter with a long dry, pineapple, peach, mango, grapefruit and piney finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

One pint can, thanks hanniku! Hazy golden color with particulates. Firm lemon and grapefruit aroma. Strong bitter and citrusy taste with lemon, grapefruit and pine. This can has probably lost the finest nuances, but this is still tasty.

Draft to stemless teku at The Alchemist. Looks good; a cloudy banana with eggshell head. Smells good too; tropical fruit and citrusy hops alongside a bit of grassiness a moderately bittersweet backbone. Mouthfeel is medium-bodied and pleasantly bitter. Delicious.

Provad på MBCC-17. Zestig och juicig med citrus och tropisk frukt i massor, rejäl lite tuggig kropp men ända ganska ren och krispig, måttlig beska. Världsklass IPA. Bland de bästa jag provat. Riktigt gott.

Sampled @ Mikkeller Beer Celebration 2017, Green Session. Fast klare leuchtend goldgelbe Farbe. Geruch ist extrem fruchtig hopfig, grapefruit, Citrusfrüchte. Geschmack ist sehr hopfig bitter, grasig, grapefruit, top.

Hazy, straw yellow, with a bit of white head. Aroma is tropical hops, with pineapple and orange. Taste is the same, and finishes clean, with mild biscuit, and a mild, background hop bitterness. Thanks, Aaron!

Can at MBCC 2017. Pours clear pale golden. Aroma of citrus, tropical fruit, pine. Medium body. Clean, crisp bittrness.

Aroma has tropical fruits, mango, hops, floral notes. 
Flavor has citrusy hops, floral notes, grapefruit, tropical fruits. Nice bitterness. Juicy. Very good.

Can. Excellent IPA, super well-rounded. Nice citrus, hop resin and tropical fruit in the mouthfeel. IMO better than Heady Topper. But this stuff about drinking from the can makes absolutely no sense, all one smells is aluminum (!) -- I know they are trying to start a trend but it is just so stupid.

Drank it from the can as advised so dont know how it looks. Lots of floral and grassy hop aroma and with lots of passion fruit notes. The taste even has lots of bitterness up front but it increases massively towards a powerful bitter finish. Low to medium sweetness and a little salty. Fruit notes of passion fruit and grape fruit in the flavor. Medium to full bodied with perfect medium to high level of carbonation. Really a solid IPA in my opinion and definately deserves to rank among the best.

Pours almost clear golden with a moderate frothy white head. Aromas of passion fruit, kiwi, grass, citrus. Taste is very fruity with a balanced bitterness and a light grassiness. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.

At home with a juicy can kindly shared by Maakun. Near clear pale golden with white head. Massive dank weed, grilled onions, parmezan cheese, tropical fruit, mostly sweet pineapple. Sweet and harsh, almost spicy, skunky, nettle bitter. Medium body, malty and juicy. Nice, dank AF.

Can shared. Bit hazy light golden with big white head. Massive dank weedy hops, lots of pineapple, some grapefruit, mango, papaya. Lots and lots of tropical fruit juice with some marijuana, cheese, light chicory and grass. Some sweet sugary malts. From the can it seems a bit more fruity and less grassy, taste is about the same: medium sweet and quite harsh bitter. Medium bodied. Really nice IPA.

Moderate bitterness with some pine sap, dry roasted peanut skins, herbal flavors (dandelion greens) and lemon peel. Light alcohol presence but a strong lingering bitterness. A pretty good IPA.

Thanks for a friend in DC who went up to Vermont to pick up this jem. Pours slightly hazy bright orange hue with a small white head and lite lacing. Nose is huge floral bomb-big crtra and Mosaic notes throughout with some slight pale husky grains but its well done. Flavors exhibit a very nice balance between the bright fresh hop onslaught and the pale malt husks. A pretty balanced beer for east coast ipa standards and it is VERY refreshing. I could drink this for hours and be very content with the complexity as well. A great IPA in my book even though its not and more C-hop "old school" style that i prefer. Pours ultra cloudy light orange with a boatload of suspended particles floating in the snifter. Super citric acid taste with almost too much grapefruit flavor and orange pulp. I dig the juiciness but I think I prefer Heady Toppers piney tones more.

Tropical fruits, mango, passion fruit, papaya, zesty and juicy, tangerine, bitter orange. Hazy gold, medium, creamy, white head. Light bitter. More tropical fruits, zesty, light dank, overripe mango, bitter orange, orange peel, soft carbonation, medium bodied, dry and bitter finish. Very nice IPA, well-balanced, amazing aroma. Can at Hop City 17, Leeds.
A deliciously fruity aroma, with amazingly fresh hop character. The fruit and hop flavour is incredibly intense, an it is also amazingly easy to drink for its abv . Incredible .

Didnt expect to roll in and find some of this hops caviar still chillin in the fridge like last weeks leftovers. Wonderful stuff. Mango, passion fruit and green onion. A little almond amaretto. Bitter finish with a hint of hoppy sweetness.

Aroma: Fruity hops with citrus and malty notes. 
Flavour: Fruity bitter with notes of lemon and grape and a malty caramel sweetness.
Colour: Golden amber with a white head.
Can at home. Semi-hazy golden pour with a thin white head. Notes of citrus, unripe tropical fruit, light onion, herbal hops, sugar and alcohol. Pretty good.

Hazy orange in color with a citrus aroma. Hints of mango amongst the cites flavor. I agree with the can, an abundance of hoppy goodness

Got in a BIF from Roguer. 16 ounce can into tulip glass, no can dating. Pours lightly hazy/cloudy medium golden yellow color with a 2 finger fairly dense and fluffy white head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Nice spotty foamy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big tangerine, red grapefruit, pineapple, peach, passion fruit, papaya, mango, melon, guava, berries, lemon zest, orange peel, citrus rind, pepper, pine, cracker, biscuit, light honey, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of citrus/tropical/fruity/earthy hop and moderate pale malt notes; with great strength. Taste of huge tangerine, red grapefruit, pineapple, peach, passion fruit, papaya, mango, melon, guava, berries, lemon zest, orange peel, citrus rind, pepper, pine, cracker, biscuit, light honey, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Moderate pine/grassy/citrus peel/peppery bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of tangerine, red grapefruit, pineapple, peach, passion fruit, papaya, mango, melon, guava, berries, lemon/orange rind, pepper, pine, cracker, biscuit, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/tropical/fruity/earthy hop and moderate pale malt flavors; with an amazing malt/bitterness balance, and zero lingering hop astringency after the finish. Moderate dryness from lingering bitterness, increasing through the glass. Medium carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately crisp, bready/grainy/creamy/sticky, and lightly resinous/rindy mouthfeel that is insane. Perfectly balanced. Zero warming alcohol for 7%. Overall this is an amazing IPA! All around incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/tropical/fruity/earthy hop and moderate pale malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, and pretty refreshing to drink. Super dank and fairly juicy on hops; just enough malt for bitter balance, with minimal residual sweetness. One of the smoothest IPAs Ive ever drank. It gets quite resinous/drying through the glass; but still remains very crisp, drinkable, and never astringent. A really delicious and highly impressive offering all around.

Clear golden with white head. Peach mango passion aroma. Bitter ripe grapefruit juice with lots of mango and passion fruit in the finish. Super tropical. Thanks Dan!!!

Aroma of nice tropical fruit hop notes with a hint of bready grain. Taste follows, clean and easy, mild bitterness. Not sure its the hype whale everyone says, but its a good IPA.

Can. Almost clear golden with big White head. A Beauty. Hoppy. Aroma of citrus, tropical fruits and floral. Light earthy. Malty backbone. Crisp bitter. Lingering bitterness with fairly long duration. Light and juicy. A great one...

Can, thanks to miamichael2. Hazy orange colour with white head. Citric and tropical fruits aroma. Sweet, tropical fruits, mango, citric taste. Medium body.

Can. Pours a hazy yellow golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty peachy hoppy aroma. Fruity malty peachy hoppy tropical fruit flavor. Has a fruity malty tropical fruit hoppy bitter peachy finish.

Beer 110000 was the winner in a head to head between two top rated IPAs...Focal Banger at #7 and Green at #14.

FB has a pungent dank fruity nose...grapefruit lime and tropical fruit but the dankness in the nose and flavor wins it. Green was pleasantly fruity, soft palate, little bitterness. A one trick pony, but still pleasant if overrated IN THE TOP 15.
Pours clear with a small, almost non existent head. Aroma of mango and pine. Tropical fruits on the taste with a nice bitterness. Good but over hyped.

Canned at The Farmhouse, Burlington.  Cloudy golden, rich head. Concentrated pear and grapefruit aroma. Mid sweet with medium body and well rounded mouthfeel. Total focus on tropical fruit hops. Passionfruit, papaya and mango. Mid bitter finish with a resiny edge. Superficial, but aromatic.

Masterfully crafted, and a great composition of flavours in its hop profile, complex and still clean and drinkable, but it?s a tad too sweet in flavour for me.

Can, of course. Pours a cloudy pale gold. You can smell the hops from two feet away. You are supposed to drink from the can, and admittedly it IS better, but I didnt. Sue me. Fresh fruity and resiny hops, mild bitterness, dryness, mild sourish notes and dry grainy malt. Jedno z moich ulubionych IPA, perfekcyjne piwo na codzień. Wytrawne, z mocną, acz bardzo owocową goryczką. Intensywny aromat marakui i mango, delikatne muśnięcie zielonej cebulki, co zupełnie w niczym nie przeszkadza. Klasa!

Pale hazy yellow colour with a white head. Citrus, tropical fruits, freshness, great bitterness and palate. Excellent!

2-3 veckor gammal burk från Mikkeller & Friends Bottleshop i Köpenhamn. Blekgul, lätt disig med högt vitt skum som ligger kvar och lämnar en del rester längs med kanterna. Friskt och piggt humle är det första som möter en. Att det rör sig om Citra och Mosaic är tydligt. Citrus, mango, ananas, persika, nektarin, passionsfrukt. Lätt gräsig och örtig. Växer till sig något men är alldeles lagom. Det är inte direkt en in-your-face IPA, utan mer sofistikerat och städat - och väldigt, väldigt bra. Superfräsch och en riktigt törstsläckare. Inte svårt att få i sig några stycken av den här. Riktigt gott!

Canned. Hazy golden with white head. Slightly raw aroma with grass, citrus, citrus, melom and bright fruitiness. Taste is zesty citrus, grass, bitter grapefruit, tropical fruitiness, melon, mango and general hop richness. Medium mouthfeel, medium carbonation and lasting rich hoppy aftertadtaste.

Can. A hazy yellow beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of hops, straw, malt, and spices. The flavor is sweet with notes of hops, malt, straw, and spices, leading to a bitter finish.

Can from a friend. Very fresh and hoppy smell with citrus and grapefruit. The taste was a bit rough, tasted like eating hops, a bit rough and left a dry feeling in my mouth. Besides that lots of hops with a high bitterness, more like a DIPA with lower ABV then a DIPA. Almost too hoppy.

Can courtesy of Martin. Very hazy tiny burnt deep yellow pour with a frothy white head. Fresh fruity NEIPA nose. Cookie dough malt base. Fleshy mango, papaya & tangerine. Fresh grass and light pine. Pour is beautiful hazy light orange with a small and fluffy white head.

Taste is slightly fruity sweet up front, but sure has a heavy dose of dry bitterness to it. Every sip wanna make you sip again. 
Medium bodied, with a fresh and sparkly carb. Lovely stuff.

Many fresh (1-2 weeks old) cans sourced from Mikkeller Webshop, Copenhagen - (drunk both from the can and glass) hazy golden coloured pour with nice white puffy head and lacing. On opening the aroma bursting forth is intense hoppy goodness, taste follows with a plethora of resonating juicy tropical and citrus hits of grapefruit, mango, tangerine, clean malty base, hop resin, pine needless, and love the intense bitter hoppy finish. Citra and Mosaic being my favourite hop profiles this works so well on every level for me. Beautiful.

From my loving, caring wife! Lovely fruity citrus and pine aroma. Piney, slightly resinous flavour, more fruityness. Solid, juicy mouthfeel with lasting bitter finish. Smooth, so flavourful and perfectly balanced.

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2016 (473ml can from Mikkeller Webshop, ~ 9 days old) Pours lightly hazed pale gold with a moderate white head that fades quickly to a ring with spotty lace. Aroma is totally hop loaded with notes of mango, pineapple, mixed citrus zest and a bit of orange and grapefruit juice, cat piss, grass, pine/weed resin, light passion fruit and floral notes, subtle clean pale malt. Flavour of citrus, especially grapefruit and orange with a bit of lime, subtle mango, oily citrus peels, grassy, dank and catty hop resins, pine, light floral in the finish, lean pale malts, touch of cracker. Can. I had it from the can but poured a bit into a glass and it pours light and hazy orange colour with a white head. Fresh from can: Aroma of tropical fruits, peach, grapefruit, lime zest, caramel notes and some pine too. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and solid bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent IPA. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Can. Aroma has tons of flowers and citrus. Taste has instant bitterness, hard-core but still subtle. Really fresh but without killing you. Lightly malty base. A small pour into a glass reveals a clear light golden pour with thick off-white head. I could drink this all day.

Hazy yellow orange pour with a dense white head. Great lacing. Some sediment floating around. Aroma is tropical, pine, grapefruit. Taste is bright pineapple, grapefruit, pine, mango, and some biscuity malt. Smooth bitterness.

Ignored the "drink from the can" directions. Poured a pale golden with white chunks/particles floating in suspension......aroma is grapefruit.....taste is amazing, with mango, citrus and overwhelming grapefruit. The most amazing IPA Ive had to date.

can recieved in a trade. poured a hazy deep golden colour with a foamy white head. nose of bright citrus fruits, pineapple, sweet tropical fruit juice, mango, and just a slight resinous pine note. taste is big sweet tropical fruit, mango, and papaya sweetness. hop bitterness and a soft malt notice. nice full bodied mouthfeel and carbonation

Can. Color hazy dark yellow with medium white head. Aroma sweet, malt, floral, oine, mellow. Taste bittersweet, floral, pine, citrus, mellow, bitter finish.
Half from can, half in glass. Cloudy but not super hazy golden. Aroma is pungent - juicy citrus. Sweet with light bitterness, very dangerously drinkable - pineapple, orange, deliciousness.

The little brother of the famed Heady Topper, big cheers to Ster for offering me the can. Thick, densely moussy, frothy, stable, egg-white head over an initially warm old golden blonde beer with fierce sparkling and some yeast bits here and there, hugely increasing in numbers at the end, eventually lending the beer a muddy, ochre-hued, milky appearance. Lively and fragrant bouquet of lime juice, sugared lemon, ripe mango, sweet onions, mandarin peel, freshly cut green bell peppers, crackers, tonic water, minerals, bitter honey, unripe pineapple and a light hint of spruce. Vividly fruity flavor, very crisp, with sourish redcurrant and green plum-like impressions mingled with sweeter mango, starfruit and light banana, fizzy carbo, smooth oily mouthfeel. Lightly biscuity malt sweet middle with a sharper grainy edge to it, perfectly supporting the star of the show, making its entrance at an early stage: a wealth of aromatic hoppiness, with a ton of retronasal citrus, mango and green banana as well as a piney accent; in the mouth, a deeply grapefruity, strong, resinous bitterness is established, drying the back of the mouth to a large extent but letting just a trace of sweet maltiness pass through in the end, keeping the finish juicy. As with Heady Topper, the brewer recommends "drink from the can", but obviously that would not serve this beer right: this is a modern IPA of utmost balance, elegance and finesse, in which all the components are perfectly dosed, much like in its big brother. Glad I finally tasted this, a beautiful example of this brewerys quality standard.

Can. Light hazy light golden liquid with medium white head. Aroma of citrus, tangerine, mango, weed, lychee and light grain. So dank. Taste is dry and medium bitter with notes of tangerine, lychee, mango, fresh hops and weed. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Awesome. Drinkable. Juicy. Dank.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2017 Can. Pours golden hazy with offwhite head (I broke the rules and poured in a glass). Aroma is Dank and Fruity. Taste is sweet fruity (Lemon and Grapefruit) with a piney lemon grapefruit zest finish. Very bitter zest finish of which i like. Glad i finally got to try it. 

Updated 3/10/17 from another can.  Changed overall to 17.  Very solid.

Pounder->SA (and also drank the last of it straight from the can), courtesy of jc1762, thanks Jon! Gold with small white head and ugly white floaters Loads of juicy citrus hops, resin, pine, hint of malt. Juicy and awesome.

Style et résumé: IPA avec un gros «hype». 
Comment: Canette achetée au Vermont, merci Vincent. 
Description: Une bière dorée avec une mousse blanche. Un nez dagrumes intenses et de houblon. Une bouche piquante, mordante avec beaucoup de houblons aromatiques et une touche de savon. Un peu déçu avec tous ses commentaires dithyrambiques.
Note:  7+/10
Can sample at Warszawski festiwal piwa, thanks to Grzegorz Korcz. Lots of hoppy fruits in aroma, mostly tropical ones. Taste is light bitter, flavor of mango, pineapple, pomelo. Wow.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking a Focal Banger by The Alchemist at Stadion Miejski Legii Warszawa im. Marszałka Józefa PiłsudskiegoJedna z lepszych ip jakie sprobowalem w zyciu. Dziekuje Pan Korcz :)Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Can shared. Thanks Jon and Kaori! Pours a lightly hazy, glowing straw. Big papaya and passion fruit notes dominate the nose with more dank hop aromas coming out in the background. Light bodied with great carbonation. Tons of fruit mid-palate and then a big bitter finish. Great stuff!

16 oz can with DCLawyer and radagast83. Courtesy of jc1762, thanks Jon! Clear golden yellow with off-white head. Aromas of floral notes, citrus, garlic and onion, tropical fruit. Tastes of floral notes, pine, citrus, onion. Medium body with a dry finish. Really nice.

Poured into a glass. Super cloudy light orange color. Frothy off-white head. Very bright fruity-citrus aromas and flavors. Bready texture. Mild bitterness. Lots of juicy aromatics. Long dry bitter finish.

16oz can shared by Jc1762. Thanks Jon! Poured a golden orange with a haze to it, then final part of the glass was full of floaties. Drink from the can guys. Aroma was stone fruits, citrus, light herbal notes. Flavor was nice, herbal notes, peach, light malt balance was nice. Tasty!
Can at the Ginger Man. Poured hazy orange with white head. Aroma good blend of hops citrus. Light carb med bod. Taste light bitter herbal grassy orange.

Very hazy golden white. Very hoppy nose with lots of rock melon, buscuit, lime, fresh cut wet grass. Perfectly balanced, massively juicy hops, but soft malt notes support this. Somewhat bitter finish. Super well executed. A showcase of NE IPA

Aroma is grapefruit with some bread. Flavor is perfectly balanced. Hoppy, not too bitter and a lot of citrus. No maltiness whatsoever. Pours hazy yellow orange with a thick sticky white head. Awesome 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft sample at the source. Clear copper with a white head of foam. Mild pine and soft citrus notes. Some bitterness. Creamy mouthfeel. Medium body and medium carbonation.

Superfresh can: Aroma is outright citrus loaded with lemon rind and supergrassy high notes. Taste is grapefruit, unripe tangerines, oranges with a super citra hop kick in the nuts in the end. This is my stuff. Aggressive bitterness in the end.

500ml can. Tasted in can, but have had in a pint glass; theres no discounting golden straw pour with the massive amounts of floaty chunks. Best served with them out of sight. Nose is huge Mosaic, gorgeous. Pine, some citrus, grassiness. Crisp, sharp bitterness, pleasant in mouth. Not surprisingly, excellent.

Drank from the can. Thanks Tom10101 for this one. Aroma is all about hops, citrus, grass, pine and slight notes of malt. Taste features a pleasant bitterness. Good crispy notes. Dry finish. Highly drinkable.

Light hazy gold with a fingers worth of head. Aroma of peach, stone fruit, pineapple, citrus, herbaceous. Taste follows nose with peach, citrus, light berry, herbaceous tones, and bready malt. Medium body, medium bitterness. Like this a bit more than Heady.

Drunk from the can - 7th Oct 2016. Thanks to Leighton for the super generous gift. Aroma is massive grass, resinous pine. Taste is more about the Mosaic than the Citra. Big bitterness but perfectly matched with the malt backbone. While not quite at the level of Heady this is an IPA that holds its own against the big ones.
user_location: The big bad LDN, Greater London, ENGLAND

text: IPA deliciosa. Fresca, aroma intenso, espalha ao servir, bem cítrico. Boa carbonatação, bonita cor. Na boca, cítrica, florar, amargor mais alto que o esperado, um harsh leve e bem vindo. Final com suaves secura e amargor.

475 ml can at home, 1 month old. Hazy goolden orange color with white head. Hoppy aroma, pine, grass, citrusy fruity, grapefruit, some orange, some cat piss notes in the beginning, some sweet malty notes when it gets warmer. Sweet and heavy biter taste like aroma. Medium to full oily body with soft carbonation.
Burk Bryggarhunden. Doftar lite blött gräs, svagt ladugård och piss. Rejäl beska omedelbart i munnen. Blommig, vindruvor, äpple och grape. God

can, split in 3 - poured in wine glass. Pours lightly hazed, dark yellow to light golden. Nice small head, remaining a long time. Refined exotic hops aroma, mingling pineapple, lytchee, tangerine zeste, grapefruit juice. Body lacks a bit of sweetness to balance the hopiness out. Taste is grapefruit peel. Hoppiness is overpowering the whole sensation a bit, bitter and dry finish. Loads of character.

Obtained from a co-worker God bless her. Aroma of fresh pungent hops. Taste is malty as a necessity. Hops are the flavor of the day. Start to finish. Actually if you hold on long enough the malt come back around to round it out. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma is full of citrus, pine, and spicy pineapple hop notes. There is a malted grain sweetness coming from the can too. Tasting there is a clean yet sharp bitterness that fades to be rather pleasant. I picked up on a sweet malty backbone that balances this beverage somewhat. The hop flavor is similar to the aroma notes. The finish is extremely kind and subdues the hop forward flavor leaving a pleasant bitter, sweet, hop flavor. I enjoyed the soft dryness to the finish. The body is well done too. Overall a damn good IPA. It is very flavorful and drinkable.

UPDATED: SEP 26, 2016 Thanks as always to Adrian. Cool cartoon on label. Aromatic, tangy, expressive. Pleasantly vegetal hops (mosaic and citra) n the forefront. A little tangerine, caramel, and rosemary in the flavor. It is great to try Alchemist?s new releases. It was a few weeks old by the time I had it so I didn?t get it super fresh, but it was still very good.
Aroma was incredible, very bright. Citrusy and piney both playing a role. Very dank taste. Citrusy/grapefruit notes, some malt too. Very flavorful and also very well balanced. Awesome awesoem

Wow this guy has lots of hops. Sweet nose - citrus mainly very fragrant I was drinking very fresh brought from the brewery two weeks ago. Taste is tropical - I think pineapple. Then the hops take over and blast you away. Appearance - quite chunky in bottom of my glass. Quite good. Thanks Wally!!!!

Can from the brewery into a pilsner glass showing cloudy whitish yellow with a finger of clean white foam. 

The nose shows mild grapefruit. 

The palate is light bodied and well carbonated. Flavors of light cannabis and moderately juicy pineapple with a light bitterness. Subtle pineapple in the aftertaste.
A: Cloudy yellow/light peach coloured with a thin white head N: Hay, grass, red apple T: Pine, grapefruit, orange zest O: Nice bitterness, but quite easy drinking even with the 7% abv. Nice!

Can pour hazy avg gold with moderate white head. Nose big hops, resin, green onion, and grassy. Taste moderate bitter bite up front, then grassy, grilled green onions, resin. Light bitter finish. Nice big hop bomb.

2016/09/13 - Drank directly out of the can as instructed. Aroma is grapefruit, hints of mango, pale malt, onion, grass, pine and lightly dank notes. Taste follows nose; grapefruit and lots of pine, with a pale malt backbone and notes of onion, grass and dank, light spicy hops. Light sweetness and ample bitterness. Mouthfeel is full and chewy with moderately biting carbonation and long, highly drying finish. Really nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Great big juicy mango tropical hop aroma. Flavor has the same tropical hops but with a strong piney resinous hop finish. Dry piney finish. Full flavored but much lighter body than heady. Very tasty beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a cloudy, pale yellow, with minimal head. Aromas of citrus and tropical fruit, though rather muted. Flavor is marked by both citrus and tropical fruits, plus a nice bitter hop bite. Very nice IPA.
16 ounce can with a big thanks to Jason. Pours a nice looking IPA with big aroma and lots of mosaic and citra. Excellent.

16oz can - and yes, we did pour it into a glass. Poured a hazy yellow color with a white head. Citrus, resiny, pine, and hoppy. Had this with Heady Topper & The Crusher - nice to have them all together.

Received via trade with Ed at Heritage Liquors in Maplewood, Minnesota. Pours a semi-hazy golden pale straw colored brew with a thick and rocky off-white head that has excellent retention that does does not go away. Aroma of sweet Walla Wall onions, grapefruit, weedy, piney, and spicy hops that over-powers any of the golden grain malt bill. Taste is thick and chewy full bodied, with flavors of Maui onions, grapefruit, pine, enriched golden grain malt and ale yeast. Finish is semi-sweet at first followed by a lingering sweet, yet bitter aftertaste that really lingers on. Tongue shock recovery time is about five minutes.
UPDATED: SEP 20, 2016 Citrus hoppy, plenty of bitterness. Some floaties and unappealing sediment. My fav of the brewery.

Can @ Monkish. Thanks for sharing, Henry. Cloudy golden beer with a white head. The nose is big on pine, grapefruit, and a ton of dank. This has somewhat of a funky onion and garlic thing going on. Probably Mosaic. The flavor is really quite bitter, which I guess I wasnt expecting from this brewery. Huge resinous pine and some grapefruit rind. Its an okay beer, but a little too aggressive and assertive on the bitterness for me.

Daffodil, pineapple, grapefruit bouquet, dank. Cloudy amber, medium head, chunks of varying sizes, some significant. Grapefruit, daffodils, yeast. Full body, resinous, easy carbonation. Super grapefruity, but certainly not one note. Intense hop flavor, very special. I really wish I could get this more easily.

Can [from trade with petrinoda] @ home. Thanks Dan! Hazy orange golden color, full sized white head. Aroma is loaded with hops, fruit hops, somewhat grassy, tropical fruits. Flavor is moderately malty, packed with fruit hops, hops, fruit hop bitter. Incredibly fresh and crisp, superb hoppy, fruit hops and tropical fruit flavors, moderate bitterness with light grapefruit and light passion fruit. Suitable medium body, soft to medium carbonation, Absolutely lovely, a great IPA.

Can courtesy of Rck G from Lardo. Colour...cloudy gold with a thick head. Nose...wet, musty hops and cigar humidor. Palate...massively dry and tightly gripping with hugely bitter hops! I can tell that theres pine needle and sap but the strangulation of the bittering is immense, though rather enjoyable. The finish is incredibly long and strong!

Huge fruit juiciness (orange, tangerine) from the Citra & Mosaic hops underscored by a light graininess that lingers towards the clean, decisively bitter finish. The alcohol is barely noticeable. Just an outstanding example of an East coast style IPA. Cheers!

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2016 From can, thanks to MrOrla! Shared with Kromutter. Pours hazy golden with a dense off white head. Aroma of peaches, pine, tropical fruits, light dank, light honey malt. Taste is tropical, pine, sweet with a bitter finish, mango, more dank than the aroma indicated. Just lovely and very well balanced.

Drank from the can during a round of disc golf thanks to N8daGr8 ! Lots of melon and candied citrus throughout with a soft toasted grain backbone that carries the hop flavors gently from the front to the back of the palate. Super crisp and dry and delicious !

Une mousse bien blanche et assez onctueuse saccroche à une bière trouble de couleur dorée penchant sur lorange. Le pamplemousse, lananas et dautres agrumes se lâchent lousse dans un bouquet où quelques effluves épicés chatouillent également les poils nasaux. En bouche, lamertume est franche, mais pas agressive, et sappuie bien sur les saveurs fruitées très explosives et une céréale pâle juste assez présente pour ajouter un certain croquant à chaque gorgée. Une texture soyeuse conjointement à une carbonatation aérienne rendent lexpérience encore plus agréable. Exactement mon genre dIPA.

Can from facebook trade, thanks Javier. Drinking out of can as the instructions demand. bit of grassiness and metallic onion at the end. Nice clean beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can shared by mugdiller. Poured clear copper color with a large frothy off-white head that lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy complex citrus and earthy hop aroma. Medium to full body with a slick texture and soft carbonation. Moderate to heavy bittersweet flavor with a moderate to heavy bittersweet finish of medium to long duration. Very good brew.

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2016 473ml can, huge thanks to Jan! Pours yellowish orange with a smooth head. Aroma of juicy fruits, fresh hops, grass, hay, citrus, grapefruit, tropical notes. Taste is fresh hoppy, juicy and citrusy with some grapefruit, tropical notes and grass. Finish is fruity hoppy, citrusy and grassy with some grapefruit, mango, tropical notes and lingering bitterness. Tasty stuff.

Can shared by mugdiller. Pours a hazy golden color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have big earthy, oniony, garlic character, citrus and tropical fruit, dank hops, pale toasted malts, caramel, I thought this was well done in spite of the fact that I dont like the onion character too much.
Tried side by side with heady. Extremely similar but more juicy and less dry. Looks identical. Thx thepatrickman.

Nose is full of mosaic and citra hops - lots of tropical, citrus, juicy fruit, soft malt base pale and possibly a little bread. Occasionally I get some sweatiness from the mosaic. Lightly hazed golden pour, nice white head. Flavors of citrus, dank, some juicy fruit gum, some light sweat and garlic show up. Clean crisp malt base with light bread and sweetness. Lingering chewy juicy hops. Really nice. If I lived in Vermont I would buy it. Would I line up for hours or follow trucks around to get it? No. Would I trade for it and post pictures on the computer bragging to people that I have it? No, but Im not Cordova or Enloe and I have plenty of friends already and was moderately sociable in both high school and college so I have nothing to compensate for. Glad I got to try it. Thanks!

Can from the brewery, less than a week old. Focal banger IPA 7%

An opaque orange honey gold with a thick foamy head. Prickly pear and big juicy hop notes in the aroma. Medium to light bodied with a ton of juicy raspy hops - definitely a New England ipa. Good stuff. 3.8

Pours a hazy honey colir with a fluffy medium white head. Aroma has some scalliony/grassy notes, citrus rind...grapefruiy...pine...mild vut juicy melin and stonefruits peek through. flavor follows suit...lots of delicate hoppy flavors...rindy bitterness...grapefruit us just accentes with subtle pine and grassisness...awesome. mouthfeel is light/medium and lively with a dry and rindy/resinous bitter finish.
From the can. Nice looking can. Tropical fruit and resin aromas. Tropical fruit and pine aromas. Dry with sweet mango, mild garlic and passionfruit upfront turning to resin in the lasting finish.

Can from a friend. Turbid straw pour with white head. Nose is that huge and great Vermont IPA nose, with florals, honeydew, mango, and juicy hops. Tastes hoppy, floral, fruity, with a smooth and very hoppy finish. This one is as good as my friends told me it was. Outstanding.

Can, 1 pint. Sparkling clearish golden with a frothy offwhite head. Juicy tropical hop aromas, hints of citrus, caramel, resin. Medium bodied, fizzy carbonation. Thick and oily. Medium sweet, heavily bitter. Stinging hoppy and malty character into a harsh hoppy and alcohol finish.

Can, 1 pint. A clear golden beer with a small white head. Aroma is of floral hops and citrics. Taste is medium bitter with moderate sweetness. Medium bodied, fizzy carbonation and some astringency. Dry and with a floral bitter aftertaste.

Pours a moderately hazy golden with a small white head that leaves nice lacing. Nose is of onions, garlic with some very light cat pee. Taste is moderately sweet and firmly bitter, offers some nice tropical fruits along with some alcohol. Some onions carry into the taste as well. Long lasting bitter finish, a little peppery. Body is medium, carbonation moderate. Oily. A pretty good IPA but I tend to prefer mine fruitier/juicier and this one is a tad too onion-centric for me to enjoy it fully.
16oz can pours a hazy yellow amber color with a lot of flocculation. Well balance hop flavors that are very smooth. Lemony citrus flavors.

16oz can thanks to Jeremy. Followed The Crusher with this, which is also but stands just in the shadow of the Crusher. Pale golden with small airy head., A melange of malts and hops with some floral notes, carries over to the taste, a bit lighter than the former, and more savory to boot. The Alchemist has it going on!

16 oz can won in a raffle from David Stoops! shared with ebone1988. The pour is a foggy golden orange color with a thick cap of white head that has great retention and a spectacular lace. The aroma is full of mosaic hops. The malt is still gone and its crisp and clean. I wish there were a little more citra and some fruitiness, but its nice and clean. The flavor is a lot maltier than I was expecting. The hops balance nicely and there is a strong citra and mosaic hop aplenty. The mouth feel is excellent. There is a light crispness to it and a great carbonation. The aftertaste is lingeringly sweet hop and a light malt. Its good for sure, but not quite what I was hoping for.

Can shared with koleminer20. Aroma is citrus, tropical fruit, pine, floral, dank, lovely. Appearance is golden, hazy, white head. Taste is citrus, pine, rind, tropical fruit, some malt. Mouthfeel is light body, light crisp carbonation, citrus pine wonderful aftertaste. Overall, solid. Ive been looking forward to this.
16oz can. Hazy yellow. Aroma is a face full of fresh off the vine hops. Resin, dank, pine. Taste is fresh bitter hops. Really bitter but really smooth. Lingering resinous hop aftertaste.

500mL can, sent from yourilevesque (thanks a lot, Youri!), pours a cloudy golden orange with a small white head. Aroma is wonderful, with tons of piney and resinous hops, tropical stone fruits and just enough sweetness to back. Flavour is likewise phenomenal, with truckloads of piney and resinous hops, tropical fruits - especially melons and passionfruit, and a thin caramely bready malt backbone. Impeccably constructed and balanced, with hugely high drinkability. Fantastic stuff.

From my sources: pours lightly hazy gold (though I did drink some of it from the can) with a white head. Aroma is rather large citrus, much in the way one would expect... Nice grapefruit and the like. Taste is moderately bitter, especially at the end and into the finish. Some piny notes are present back there as well. Lingering aftertaste in a good way. Low sweetness. Very nice. What you want in an IPA.
Not too much to say about this outside of incredible. Two of my very favorite hops combine in a can. Enjoy!

Really cant believe this is the first time Ive had this beer. tall-boy can bought last week in stowe VT. Smells amazing! Total citra bomb on the aroma. this aroma is stupid good. This is an intense beer. super-hopped, super-malted, very dry finish with that great alchemist yeast strain, sweetness persists throughout, it smells better than it tastes but Im digging the bread-like doughy juicy sweetness this beer has.

Draught at the brewery on 7/8 and a fresh can on 7/16/16.Medium-sized white head tops a moderately hazy, glowing, lemon pulp yellow body. Retention is average to high.Beautifully aromatic mosaic provides intensely juicy mango-pineapple-lychee while the citra deftly dries things out with its more dusty, sweaty lemony funk. Add in a good dose of rich, honey-like maltiness and zero resin/pine, clean yeast and no alcohol and youve got yourself a highly enjoyable, top-tier NE IPA.Continued softness and juiciness in flavor and texture, as tight carbonation keeps up a good effervescence, helping keep the palate free from fatigue and brightening the finish. Lemons, keylimes, mangoes and other juicy tropical fruits abound. Just enough bitterness to balance the succulent malts and no resin or alcohol. Awesome stuff. Sad I never got to try this back in they day, but glad they are making it again.

Bottle shared at level 42 Canary wharf tasting. 11/07/2016. Huge thanks to Leighton for this one. . A hazed bright yellow straw coloured pour with a a lasting white head. Aroma is big dank hop, onion, plastic, lemon rind. Flavour is composed of of light grains, straw, big dank hop, onion, lemon citrus. Really assertive citrus hop bitterness. Palate is frothy, velvety grainy. Really good. Really good.

Pours hazy apricot with a thick eggshell head. Aroma delivers yeasty and hippy tones. Hoppy flavor has yeasty and fruity notes in attendance. Mouthfeel features decent body and fizz. Focus on this banger! Speaking of focus - my Ford Focus recently hit 100,000 miles. Way to go, Connie!

500cl can shared at the July CW tasting, London. Many thanks to Leighton for this one. It pours a hazed pale golden color with a medium white head. Aroma is sweet and danky with plenty of pineapple, tangerine, danky weed, grass, lemon peel. Taste is also big sweet danky notes with lemon, grass, straw, melon, grapefruit, big danky onion notes. Closes bitter dry. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, great beer

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2017 July 2016 -Can share at Level 42, with many, many thanks to LKS for yet another great beer. As Alchemist Focal Banger, 7%. Hazy opaque orange, small foamy white head, light lacing. Aroma is oniony, spicy, pungent fruits, rubbery. Body is smooth, soft carbonation. Taste is lightly piney, grassy, oniony, some mango, papery dry chalky finsih. A very tasty, spicy hoppy beer. Feels like its getting me drunk, despite the moderate ABV - though I did have a big pour of this one. (4.0)
December 2016 - Can at Leightons, with thanks to the bro himself.  Has fallen away a touch but still very drinkable.

Can at level 42 tasting. Thanks to Leighton. Pours hazy blonde with thin white head. Aroma is dank with a little tropical fruit. Taste is tropical fruits with dank and a bitter finish. Really good stuff

16oz can. Milky blonde with a thick white froth. Flavors are doughy cereals, mango, orange peel, resinous hops, spruce gum, marijuana and garlic with grassy and dank notes. Light to medium body, soft carbonation, creamy texture.
Can from the new brewery. Worth the wait. Very strong hop aroma. Flavour is citrus, sweet and dank. Incredibly well balanced. This beats heady for me, nearly perfect beer.

Finally getting around to writing a review for this one. Ive been fortunate enough to have had several cans of this over the last year. Consumed right out of the can. Upon opening, a huge blast of fresh hops and grapefruit hit the olfactory senses. Unapologetic and assertive hops. Dank and resinous. Juicy and delicious. Im not saying that this is better than Heady Topper, but like Heady Topper, I feel that this beer is essentially flawless. Every single time I have had it, I have been most impressed. My highest recommendation.

Can at Church Street Tavern. Clear golden color. Pine citrus hops aroma. Resin tropical fruit hops flavor. Well balanced flavor. Medium body. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2016 Can at Church Street Tavern while sitting outside on the main street of Burlington. Commonshawn, rosskyle, and samadouche there to imbibe. Hard to judge the color but going to assume its a golden and pretty beautiful. Aroma is pretty standard hops with a mix of citrus and tropical fruits. Some nice pine qualities. Taste is basically a near perfect rendition of an IPA. Really solid balance. Nice hoppy bitterness, sweetness, and hides its alcohol content well. Feels like a slightly more approachable but slightly less enjoyable version of the Heady Topper. This brewery knows what its doing.

16 ounce shared can. Pours a cloudy pale gold with a decent white head. Aroma of citrus, tropical, and floral. Taste is pineapple, lemon, grapefruit, melons, floral, malt, and a touch of pine. Very tasty.

From a can pours a hazy golden color with plenty of particles floating about and an off-white head. The smell is citrus, slight dank. The taste is big citrus with underlying dank, tangy citric, she tropical fruit while ending dry. Medium bodied with average carbonation.

Poured into a glass no matter what the top of the can says. Nearly opaque apricot hue with a sudsy white dome. Aroma is pungentthe scent of scallions, dried grass and mellow stone fruits buoyed by clean oyster cracker malts can be picked up far from the glass. Flavor is smooth and incredibly balanced and integrated, leading with notes of grapefruit peel and sweet tangerine to a flash of fruity sweetness that distracts from growing pithy bitterness. Would appreciate a brewed on date on the can; its impossible to tell how fresh this is.
pretty damn good. It is a mellower more citrus Heady Topper. I think I may like this more.

Can at black back pub. Very pale yellow straw color with small head. Lemon pastry and floral and spice aroma. Tropical fruit grassy sweetness medium citrus rind and spice bitterness dry finish medium light body soft lively carbo.
Smell is hops, citrus and pine. Taste is mango, orange tropical fruit, dank hops and pine. Bitter on finish. Medium body, medium carb.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2016 Cloudy yellow pour, smaller head and specks of lace. Peach, pineapple and grass aroma. Quite juicy, none of the onion character that Heady sometimes has, peach, pineapple, grapefruit. Bitter aftertaste.

Can shared with jamesy at the MBC Dinner release. Tried side-by-side with Heady, and they are definitely similar but noticeably different. Focal is significantly more citrusy, and the hop bitterness is more restrained. This is really fantastic -- complex, fruity, and a little resiny.
Can at Green Mountain Inn. Essentially 99% of Heady Topper. Slightly mellower. 99% of my Heady review. 1% extra Vermont water. Delicious.

Enjoyed from can at The Skinny Pancake in Montpelier cloudy yellow gold with a nice white head. Awesome aroma of citrus peach floral tones and hop. Taste is slightly dry with notes of grass pine and a balanced mouth feel. Another exceptional beer.

Can. Pours copper color with off white head. Nose and taste are cirtrus, melon. I was really surprised how dry this finished. Did a side-by-side with Heady. I liked Heady a little better. A little sweeter.

Dobre piwo o mocnej podbudowie słodowej.
Chmiel czuć jak owocowy mus bardzo smaczny.
Przyjemne delikatne ipa które jest bardzo poprawne.
Barwa złota zmętniona. Nasycenie niskie.

Pint can at Blackback Pub 9/23/2015. Pours a cloudy deep yellow gold with a medium sized frosty white head. Aroma of bitter hops, grassy notes, spruce and earth. Taste of spruce, bitter hops, earth and grassy notes.
Can at Arvads, Waterbury. Colour is deep cloudy orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Massive fruitiness, tropical fruits, hops and malts. Enormous drinkability.

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2016 Canette bue en juin 2014. Doux arômes tropicaux, une tonne de mangue et tangerine, notes de pamplemousse, pêche, résine de pin. En bouche le pamplemousse et orange explosent pour laisser la place à des saveurs  de mangue et ananas avec un soupçon de résine de pin. Peu maltée, que du houblon. Texture semi-onctueuse et corps mince à moyen.

Drinking from 16oz can. I really didnt know what to expect from this beer as it was bought in Poland from the distributor "Berr Geek Madness" around June 2015, and imported by them to Poland around April so I thought there will be little of hoppy aroma left. To the contrary there is a wonderful mixture of citrus and piny hoppy aromas. Looks pretty clear, with light colour as for the West Coast IPA. The head could be longer and better. In taste there are citrus notes, little malt and great bitterness. Wonderful IPA I can reccommend to every beergeek who likes his IBUs ;)

16oz can. After driving all over the state looking for Heady found some at The Vermont Tap Room along with its little brother Focal Banger which I did not even know was a thing. Focal, as would be expected, was also insanely delicious though maybe slightly less so than the Heady. Poured into a glass (against the clear instructions on the can it looks every bit as hazy as heady. The flavors are more grapefruit and the after taste more bitter. So good.

July 15, 2015. Can at The Farmhouse Tap & Grill. 
Straight from the can but probably cloudy as hell. Aroma is very hoppy, fruity and dank with peach, orange orange, pineapple, grass, pine, onion and light herbal. 
Taste is light sweet, grassy, piney bitter hop notes. Finish is dry grassy and piney bitter, dank, some onion notes, sweet tropical fruits, pineapple, orange and peach. Medium bodied, average carbonation.

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2016 Update: can from the new brewery and drank at home. Waited for this moment a long time. Aroma is slightly malted, bready, pineapples, oranges. Awesome mouthfeel again. Crisp. Great stuff that I can now enjoy at home. Will sure go back some to buy some more to drink by the pool. Old rating: Can at Blue Stone. Aroma: amount of tropical fruits, pineapples, pines. App: hazy pale / straw, little lacing. Taste and palate: body, light sweetness, quite fruity, clean medium bitter finish. Overall: this is pretty good. Alcohol is well hidden in there. No problem finishing this one in a record time even though it?s 7% abv. Can?t believe this is my first Focal Banger. Will sure drink it again.

Dégustée en cannette. Bon, le 4 pour lapparence est biaisé par mon penchant pour cette cannette au desing amusant car pour dire la vérité, je nai pas vu le liquide... Une explosion de houblons dès louverture de la cannette. Ça sent le houblon bien citronné mais pas à la manière dun Citra mono-houblon. Cest pamplemoussé, léger et très herbacé. Je mattends ainsi à peu de sucres résiduels et jai raison car le liquide, de ses 7% dalcool est plutôt mince et sec. Sans être une bière sèche au sens propre du terme, le houblon attaque la bouche puis combiné à une forte effervescence et une minéralité due à la canette, se retire rapidement en ne laissant quune légère amertume en bouche. Des saveurs fruitées et gazonneuses traversent ma bouche en un éclair. Cest frais, léger, facile à boire mais peu complexe et surévaluée de par sa rareté à mon avis.

Can... Pours clear and yellow with a tiny, wispy, white head. Decent retention. The aroma is citrusy, cat pissy and musky. Full-bodied and lightly creamy with tickling carbonation. The flavor is citrusy and lightly acidic up front; then rindy and heavily bitter on the backside. Thanks to ctipping for supplying the can!
Hazed yellow/orange. Vibrant. Dank. Grassy. Sweet. Bitter. Tropical. This beer has it all. Awesome.

Surprising find on last day in Burlington at The Scuffer Steak and Ale house. I think it is better than Heady Topper. Smoother, citrus flavor, very drinkable. Only negative is it is only sold in bars and restaurants, wanted to take home to NY.

From blue stone Waterbury drank from the can a: grapefruit, piny, citrusy, floral app: cant tell t/p: med body with moderate long bitter finish.Med carbonation. O: insanely good. So hoppy perfect body and carbonation. A pleasure from the first sip to the last. Will need to drink some more of this soon, its addictive

Can from the bar at the Best Western, Waterbury VT. Delivered yesterday. Drank some from the can then poured the rest out. Its hazy, orangey gold. Barely a head. Pretty dank orange peel, and lightly herbal hop. Some overripe strawberry. The malts come across sweet, grainy, but clean. Taste is zesty, pithy bitter. Some sticky lip action going on. Smooth, fairly rich palate that stays fresh and drinkable. Gets more resinous toward the end. Finishes long, zesty bitter, with that lip sticking sweetness staying the course. Nice one.

Pours a cloudy, initially very carbonated yellowish golden with a bubbly white head, that recedes quickly. The aroma contains floral hops, grapefruit, pineapple, peach, and a little bit of orange. Very tropical nose overall. The taste is quite bitter, very dry, with just a touch of sweetness. Its heavy on grapefruit with a compliment of pine. Undertones are floral hops, orange and peach. The aftertaste is a long and bitter grapefruit flavor. Light to medium in body, very sticky in texture, and lots of carbonation in here. This is delicious. Even though Id classify this at just a notch below Heady Topper, this is one of the best IPAs Ive tried.

2015-09-23 Cannette @ Black Back Pub Waterbury. Bière jaune et trouble. Nez floral et d'agrumes très intense. En bouche houblons très résineux, floral et agrumes, sur un corps huileux. Une finale en amertume. Une bombe en bouche.
