Beautiful cloudy apricot pour, nice big white head. Aroma of peach, apricot, berries, with hints of earth and leather. Really interesting flavor: bitter, with notes of pine and resin, but still fruity and earthy.

Can to glass. Found at a hotel bar. Not sure how fresh it is. Pours a deep golden light orange color with an off white head. Aroma is a nice juicy hop character. Bitterness overpowers the hop character in the flavor. Solid, but no heady topper.
Can pours hazy yellow with thin white head. Grassy smell with slight citrus. Earthy and dank mouthfeel, some sweetness, with a finish of bitterness that is approachable.

Can at Prohibition Pig. Drank out of the can so Im not sure what it looks like. Really a fantastic beer, feels like a spinoff of Heady Topper to an extent, just with different hops. Doesnt have the same grapefruit vibe of Heady but does have a heavy Citra feel to it. Wish I could get it more often.

Hazy pale color with foamy head. Aroma is somehow spicy with dill and oregano notes. Taste follows with the same herbal notes and some dankness. Bitterness shows up in the finish and follows in the aftertaste but does not overwhelm. Body is quite light and dry. Really easy drinking and refreshing IPA with an interesting hop profile.

Can. Hazy vibrant copper with an off white head. Citrus, papaya, mango and a hint of resin, high carbonation and moderate body, slightly astringent although becomes more balanced as it warms up a bit, long bitter and citrusy finish.

Jasna, słomkowa barwa, ładna piana, i pływająca zawiesina/grudki w szkle. Bardzo intensywny aromat chmielowy: cytrusy, słodkie owoce tropikalne, a po ogrzaniu nuty tytoniowe. W smaku dominacja chmieli, strona słodowa prawie nie do wyczucia. Goryczka grejpfrutowa, na początku niska, pod koniec mocne uderzenie. Trochę zalegająca, ale przyjemna. Tytoniowa w posmaku.
Can flown in to Anchorage for Culmination fest: Poured a hazy yellow with white head. Aroma is super fresh hops. Taste is fruity fresh mosaic hops mainly with a peppery bite.
Can. Aroma: grass, citrus, peach. Nice colour but minimal head. Quite heavy bitterness. Not as good as expected, but ok.
Pours a hazy yellow with a white lacing.Dank hop aroma, earthy dank grass citrus and strawS

Can at penny cluse cafe in Burlington. Peach, pineapple, mango, pine. Smooth Rich malts. Insanely clean and smooth. I wish I could have this everyday!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2016 Can at Three Penny Taproom in Montpelier, VT. Nose is citrus, tropical, pine with notes of mango, pineapple, grapefruit. Drinks real smooth. Very well balanced. A little darkness. Medium to full body. Lively carbonation. Bitter finish. Great brew! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
16 oz. can on Phish lot - Blossom. Poured hazy orange with hop sediment. Big grapefruit notes and pine resin. Sticky with lingering bitterness. Dank. Notch below the Heady.

Really awesome! Pours cloudy golden some head lots lacing. Nose very fruity, peach. Flavours peach grapefruit, pine. Med bitter light sweet. Full sticky body, bot silky. Lasting bitterness to the finish.
Can @ Zaklad, Wroclaw. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich hops, flowers, pine, fruits, citrus and malt.

Can @ Zakład Usług Piwnych. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - citrus. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. Not fresh. 290715

Can from Chubby Muffin, at Burlington Airport.
This was poured into a stemmed pilsener. Next time from the can for John Kimmich.
The appearance was a hazyburnt yellow to orange (grapefruit looking) color. A two finger white foamy head started off and dissipated within about a minute leaving messy foamy lacing clinging to the glass.
The smell had a big sweet sticky burst of bitter grapefruit rind, extra lemon/orange rind helps to embed a nice edge. Light grassy tones arrange to balance.
The taste was bittersweet sticky citrus weaving into the aftertaste and leaving a wet grapefruit bitter finish. 
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a pretty good sessionability about it. Carbonation seemed good for the style and for me allowing the bitterness to take effect of the harshness on my tongue. 
Overall, hot damn, everything is in place to be the best AIPA on the market. This one may have eluded me for so long but now I want this all of the time.

Can at Positive Pie. Pours a hazy yellow fading into a pale orange at the center of the glass. Intense citrus and tropical fruit aromas. Ripe pineapple, citrus, some dank b.o. An apparent sweetness underlies a medium+ bitterness. The initial taste is fruity and a bit sweet; the bitterness kicks in midpalate. Fantastic mouthfeel. Medium bodied, average carbonation, a lingering bitter finish. Another excellent one by the Alchemist.

Kolor: Jasnozłoty, piwo jest zmętnione.
Piana: Obfita, drobno i średniopęcherzykowa. Średnio trwała. Pozostawia ładny lacing.
Aromat: Chmielowy, ale raczej ziołowy niż owocowy, łodygowy, trawiasty trochę. Nie aż tak intensywny, jak się spodziewałem.
Smak: Półwytrawne, średnio pełne, alkohol niemal niewyczuwalny (leciutkie grzanie w przełyk). Wysoka goryczka, zbyt długa, zalegająca. Piwo jest mocno chmielowe w smaku, ale również głównie na sposób ziołowy.
Wysycenie: Niskie do średniego. Idealne.
Opakowanie: Srebrna puszka z niewielkim nadrukiem i minimalną ilością informacji (nie ma nawet nazwy browaru). OK.
Uwagi: Niezłe IPA, ale nie powala mnie na glebę. Rzeczywiście wyjątkowa jest ilość chmielowych smaków w piwie, ale już goryczka jest zalegająca, a aromat średnio intensywny. Obawiam się, że całość nie dorasta do legendy jaką to piwo obrosło. Piwo jest obiektywnie naprawdę niezłe, ale spodziewałem się czegoś niesamowitego i jestem nieco rozczarowany.

Bottle shared at Capitol Beer & Tap Room. Pours cloudy golden with a modest off-white head and a marvelous toffee and citrus aroma. There is a full-bodied pale malt flavor with a lot of citrus. This is a real solid brew that packs a lot of flavor and sticks to the palate. Nice earthy Mosaic finish.

Trzask otwieranej puszki od razu uwalnia feerię tropikalnych aromatów, słodkie grejpfruty, mango, marakuja - to pierwsze skojarzenia. W tle delikatna trawiastość. Piwo ma piękną złocistą barwę, ładnie oklejającą szklankę pianę i niestety sporo farfocli (pewno dlatego zalecają picie z puszki :)). 
W smaku bardzo wytrawnie, lekko i owocowo (nigdy bym nie powiedział że ten zawodnik ma 7% alkoholu). Dość niskie wysycenie aż zachęca do brania kolejnych łyków, goryczka wysoka, cytrusowa i bardzo krótka - nic nie zalega, aż chce się pić kolejne i kolejne i kolejne...

Can at blackback. Poured to see color and got a bright yellow orange that was cloudy and had a medium sudsy head. Aromas of citrus, tropical, pine. Flavor of mango, pineapple, grapefruit, pine. Little dank, mosaic and citra hop profile shines. Medium body, thick texture and nicely carbed. Bitter on the finish and throughout. Amazing.

Pours, well I dont know but I bet its murky and glorious. Aroma of pine, grapefruit, citrus, tropical fruit. Taste is rich pine hop bitter with mellow fruit sweet before a bitter lingering finish. Light smooth body with soft carbonation.

WYGLĄD: Barwa złota, zmętnione. Piana drobno i średnio pęcherzykowa - niezbyt ładna, ale dość trwała.
AROMAT: Mało intensywny. Cytrusowo-owocowy z żywicznymi akcentami w tle. Poza tym: nuty zbożowe i miodowe. Wyczuwalna SIARKA. 
SMAK: Słodowość okraszona delikatną ziołowością. Cytrusowa goryczka - średnia do wysokiej, zalegająca.
OGÓLNIE: W smaku jest O.K, w aromacie mało przekonująco. Inaczej wyobrażałem sobie to piwo, ale może trafiłem po prostu na mniej udaną warkę...
Can at the Blackback Pub. Killer!! Pineapple and citrus on the nose. Dank, resin, citrus, pineapple, chewy hops, and extremely refreshing and drinkable.
Pale yellow. White head. Delicious hop nose. Big airy agressive hop flavour. Not for the faint of art.

Pina biała, drobna, obfita. Ładnie koronkuje. 
Kolor złoty, zmętnione. 
Przyjemny żywiczny i kwiatowy aromat. lekko kwaskowe.
W smaku średnia goryczka, wyraźne nuty cytrusowe. 
Alkohol dobrze zamaskowany. Lekko grzeje. 
Lekki drapiący posmak, szybko znika. 
Niezłe piwo, ale nie doskonałe.

Tasted from can. Pours a hazy yellow with nice white head. Good lacing. Aroma is citrus and tropical fruit. Grapefruit, pineapple, lemon and a little pine. Extremely well balanced clean bitterness throughout. Mild sweetness to give it a malt backbone. Flavors of citrus fruits, pine, caramel. Excellent IPA. Definitely one of the best. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazed marigold hue with ample foam. Aromatic, fruity nose with stinging pineapple notes alongside softer white peach; some green banana, garlic scape, papaya; overall pungent, but not severe. Flavor has a surprising sweetness of a traditional type, with burnt orange rinds, marmalade, and steeped tea notes maybe hinting at a touch of crystal with the pale malt. Because of this, the blueberry, citrus, and stone fruit hop flavors are less dominant than expected, and the general textural clarity of the beer is somewhat lost. So, while flavorful, compact and balanced, this version might be closer to the type of IPA this brewery helped to make obsolete than to the type it helped to popularize.
Can @ ZEBF 2015. Aroma of passion fruit, peach and citrus. Taste is very fruity and tropical, with citrus, passion fruit and orange like acidity. Great beer.
Can (per the instructions on the can). Since Im drinking it from the can I have no idea about the color. Has a strong Mosaic hop character. Mango and peach. Medium body and not too dry.
Drank at ZeeBra 2015 (20-6-2015). My first beer. Soft beer. Citrus in the taste. Pleasant one. Bitterness is really appararent in the aftertaste.

Can sampled at ZEBF 15. Pours very hazy pale golden yellow with a white head. Aroma of big citrus, tropical fruits, mango, peach and light doughy malt. Flavour is light sweet and moderate to heavy bitter. Light medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Teku glass. Golden, little hazy with medium, white head. Nice head retention and lacing. Intense citrus (zesty lemon) and piney aromas. You can find here also nice aromas of tropical fruits (mainly mango). Somewhere in the background some light crakcery notes. Taste is very bitter and refreshing, during degustation you can fell some malty sweetness. Medium body, medium carbonation, finish is long dry and bitter. No alcohol warmth, despite its bitterness the beer is highly drinkable. In overall nice crisp, clean and hoppy IPA. This is real hop bomb. Good balanced.

Orange color lightly cloudy beer, a lot of stuff floating in, big white head with nice lasing on the glass but big bubbles. Aroma: a lot of hop, but not as much as I expected, mostly pine resin, some sweet fruits. Taste: medium smooth sweetness, mango, peach, sweet orange, than high bitterness with citrus, grapefruit, grass, resin notes. Medium to full body, low carbonation, smooth beer. Overall: Im not drinkin it out of date but aroma is pretty poor and beer dont looks to well. But in taste, damn, its delicious.
Hard to follow up after heady. A solid brew in its own right, but not in the same league as HT imo.

Aromat świeżego, chmielowego granulatu, słodkie owoce i głównie mango. Piana średnio pęcherzykowa. Barwa jasno słomkowa. W smaku wytrawne, lekko kwaskowe by przy następnych łykach zrobić się bardziej owocowe. Mango pojawia się w smaku u już zostaje. Świetne wysycenie jak i goryczka oraz after taste tylko dopełaniają się wzajemnie. Fantastyczne piwo!

Can thanks to Damico during PBW. Pours a golden yellow color with white foam head. Aroma of grapefruit, citrus and slight grass. Super creamy, smoth grapefruit taste with some grassiness on backend. Wow. What a beer.

Can. Golden hazy with white head. Aroma, fresh hops, citrus fruits, tangerine, orange.  Lemongrass. Bit spicy. Very fresh. Taste, fresh hops, citrus fruits, tangerine, bitter. Bitter aftertaste, hints of grainy flavours in the aftertaste. Very good.

Can from Beer Geek Madness. Hazy golden colour, sediment. Aroma quite intensely hoppy, fruity, exotic. Does not seem so bitter in the beginning, but slowly builds up to a brutal hops kick lasting in a long finish. Pleasant sweet candyish maltiness which pokes out initially. Lots of hops flavour, fruity, resiny, tropical. Very tasty, clean beer. Alcohol hidden well though the high strength is apparent.

Zakupiony na BFF w Poznaniu. Barwa jasna złocista, aromat cytrusowy, grejfrutowy, przyjemny ale intensywnością nie powalił na kolana. Bardzo przyjemne w smaku, lekko cytrusowe z fajną, krótką niezalegającą grepfrutową goryczką. Wydaje się idealnie zbalansowane. Alkohol kompletnie niewyczuwalny wsamku,piwo jest zdradliwie pijalne. Bardzo przyjemna AIPA.

Barwa jasna prawie slomkowa, obfita drobnopecherzykowa piana, ladny lacing. Aromat po odparowaniu siarki kwiatowo-cytrusowy. Smak pelny mocno cytrusowo-zywiczny. Niestety piwo ma juz troche czasu i aromat przeszkadz mi w konsumpcji. Ale z cala pewnoscia jest to bardzo pijalna ipa.

Can courtesy of Stephen and shared with the Shape crew. 
Dorée léger trouble, col fin blanc.
Arôme est houblonné superbement bien houblonné par ailleurs, retrouve un accent Mosaic plus présent, citronné du Citra arrive en rétro. Malt maintient une bonne base. Le tout mise toujours sur le fruité.
Palais est excellent sorte de jus de houblon, résineux, citronné, sec avec un léger côté herbacé. Malt ils, pâle, pointe sèche en fin de bouche, fleurie t herbacé alternent avec une note tropicale.

Can sampled at blue stone waterbury vt. Pours a hazy golden yellow with a lasting white head. Aroma was fresh & hoppy with citrus, pine and tropical fruit. Flavor of tropical fruit, citrus, pine, grapefruit and had some herbal notes.

Nice beer had at Black back pub in Waterbury. Nice beer but I prefer reg Heady. Hazy yellow pour nice white foam. Nose is tropical fruit, citrus and herbal notes. Flavour follows suite with the herbal notes leaving a weird medicinal aftertaste. Good beer but not good enough for the hype.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can at Prohibition Pig. Pour is hazy golden with a small white head and decent lacing. Big lemon, orange zest, some grapefruit, biscuit, grassy, herbal hoppy, and lemony aroma. Taste is orange peel, grassy, resinous, piney, weed, some grapefruit, lemons, dough, and marmalade with a medium bitter finish. Medium body with high carbonation. Not nearly as good as Heady, but still delicious.
MrOrla Meets Shaun Hill. Cloudy golden with a dense white head. Aroma and taste is Hops, citrus, tropical fruits, bitter and dry. Very drinkable!
C4PAF pre-tasting. Cloudy golden with a lasting white head. Hoppy aroma of citrus, with pine and herbal notes. Dry, hoppy flavour with citrus, herbs, and pine. Delicious bitter finish

It has nice pale yellow body, hazy. Head is minimal, white, could be better. Great hoppy aroma, lot of tropical fruits with mango dominant and some citrus. Taste is full bodied, with slightly noticeable malty background. Hoppiness is dominant. Very nice controlled, mango at the front and citrus at the finish. Great hoppiness in aftertaste with accurate carbonation. No alcohol noticeable. Outstanding beer.

Poured from a can. 
Aroma is very hoppy with quite a bit of citrus and mango. Lighter melon and tropical fruit. Light cracker malt notes. 
Pours a very hazy, pale, yellow gold with a large, fairly thick, white head with good retention. High lacing and small legs. 
Flavor is slightly sweet with a medium light cracker malt note that lingers a bit in the finish. Very bitter. Moderately high hop flavor with a lot of citrus and mango as well as lighter tropical fruit and stone fruit notes. Light alcohol presence. Dry finish. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a very nice IPA with a more assertive bitterness and in some ways a less tropical fruit hop character. Nice malt profile with a light alcohol note in the finish. Nice and dry.

Can from Tommy, thanks man! Appearance is cloudy yellow with a hint of white head. Aroma is loaded with citrus, pine, and tropical fruit. Taste is lemon, pine, very crisp, with a refreshing citrus bitter aftertaste. Lots of citrus character in this one, very clean and crisp, and nice amount of bitterness to boot, very well done!

Can. Barwa slomkowa zlota, piwo metne, piana biala, obfita, gesta. Ladny lacing. Aromat sredniointensywny, owocow tropikalnych, cytrusowy, mango. W smaku slodkie owoce mango, goryczka na srednim do wysokiego poziomie. Goryczka cytrusowa, grapefruitowa, intensywny krotka, niezalegajaca. Posmak slodko goryczkowy. Mega pijalne.

(Can 0.5l/ half of can) Yellow, hazy colour. White, medium sized, medium fast to slowly falling head. Medium body, watery a bit oily texture, moderater carbonation. Aroma: Very intense, complex. Strong hoppy, tropical fruits, melon, pineapple, grapefruits, soft pine and peach. Taste: Hoppy, fruity, tropical fruits. Medium long to long, hoppy, bitter finish. Medium strong, malty sweetness. Medium strong, increasing to strong piney bitterness. Very good balanced, very high drinkability. Good.

Barwa jasna, złota. Piana obfita, średnio-pęcherzykowa, trwała, ładny lancing do tego. Aromat jest świeży i intensywny, czuć nuty żywiczne, owoce tropikalne, cytrusy - w aromacie nic nadzwyczajnego jeszcze się nie dzieje. Natomiast w smaku .... wow, coś genialnego, mamy karmel, dobra podbudowę słodową, troszkę owoców tropikalnych, wszystko to jest takie świeże. Na finiszu bardzo przyjemną średnią goryczka która szybko znika, a potem ciekawa słodycz pozostaje na języku - coś jak słodki grejpfrut. Wysycenie niskie do średniego, gładkie, bardzo pijalne - wręcz zdradziecko. Jedno z najlepszych, jak nie najlepsze IPA jakie piłem.

Can. Pours hazy yellow, white head that stays for long. Aroma is citrus, resin, tropical fruits. In taste fruity, resins, quite dry with strong and rather short bitterness. Very refreshing, drinkable, great IPA.

Intensywny aromat cytrusowy i żywiczny, leśny, aż nieco kłuje w nozdrza. Ładny, czysty. W smaku także mocno chmielowe, zdecydowanie bardziej żywiczne, ziołowe, mniej cytrusowe. Przyjemna słodowa kontra w tle, chociaż piwo bardziej wytrawne. Wysycenie średnie. Bardzo dobre, ale nie wiem, czy to najlepsza IPA jaką piłem. Mi przypominała Citra IIPA z Birbanta. Nie wychodzi poza kategorię "bardzo dobre" :).

Barwa zlota, piana obfita, trwala. Aromat intensywny, adekwatny do stylu. W smaku bardzo ciekawe i bardzo orzezwiajace, z poczatku dosc delikatne, pózniej przyjemnie przechodzi w owocowa slodycz, a na koncu czuc bardzo intrygujaca, mocna goryczke.

Sick can, but if you were to pour it out... It's pale yellow with med white head. At the Blackback Pub, this place is the tits. Aroma is dank pine, citrus, mango, tangerine, grass, then there's the unmistakable patented alchemist yeasty fruity funk. Flavor is clean pale bready hoppy malt, citrus & tropical fruits, signature funk. Really clean, super drinkable... Lovely really.

Golden colour, nearly to clear. Quite nice white head. Really fresh hoppy aroma, lot of citrus fruits and characterical notes for Mosaic. Taste is quite sweet with also strong hoppy atack. Bitterness is medium, but fits to this beer. High drinkable

Poured into glass. Pale yellow color with medium white but short-lasting head. Great aroma of american hops. Lemon, tangarine, grapefruit, pineapple, some resin notes. Taste starte with fruity sweetness and ends with very pleasant bitterness. Soft, medium carbonation. Very drinkable. Best IPA I?ve had so far.

Thanks to frenchyraoul. It says to drink from the can, but I took my chances and poured some into a glass. The new can design is quite nice, though. The beer is yellow, fairly pale, with just a bit of orange to it. Pretty hazy. Big white head. Lots of lacing and very good retention. Big juicy hop aroma. Lots of tropical and citrus fruitiness with a solid resiny backbone running through it. Its big on pineapple, tangerine, grapefruit, pine, mango. Good stuff. The taste has moderate to medium bitterness. Lots of hop flavor. Mild pale malt character. A nice mineral note. Finishes pretty dry. Easy drink. Soft, full mouthfeel. Packs a lot of flavor. Its a very satisfying IPA. Excellent work from Vermont.

Can, pours, hazy, golden with stable white head. Intense citrus and piny aroma. Quite high bitterness, citrus and grapefruity notes in taste, delicate sweet-malty background. Medium body, average carbonation, bit astringent citrus-bitter finish.

0.473 can. Hazy, dark gold color and a large, white head leaving some lacing. Aroma of pine trees, resin, grass, mango, and multivitamin juice. Taste is fruity sweet, obviously there is some bitterness but it isnt tart and doesnt create the sensation of having your gums sucked. Medium body, slick texture, and soft carbonation. Finish finally presents the strong, lingering bitterness, but somehow it does not offend and is mostly balanced off by the fruity sweetness. Overall the best IPA I have had so far, the key seems to lie in the balance.
Nice tropical fruit characteristics all around. Little malt flavor and huge tropical hop aroma and bitterness.
Can at BGM2. Fresh, crisp, green hoppiness upfront, with resin, citrus and herbal notes. Dangerously drinkable. Lovely stuff.

Can, obtained at Beer Geek Madness 2. Hazy orange golden color with huge white head. Strong resiny hops in aroma together with grapefruit, grapeftuit zest, pines. Strong citrusy, resiny hoppy bitter taste together with grapefruits, pines, grapefruit zest. Solid malty backbone. Long hoppy bitter finish. Tasty one.

Po przelaniu do szkła (zalecane przez Johna Kimmicha "picie wprost z puszki" jakoś mnie nie przekonuje) tworzy się dość spora, choć szybko opadająca, drobno, średnio i w końcu po chwili również grubo pęcherzykowa piana ze średnim lejsingiem. Barwa złoto-żółta, mocno opalizująca, a po dolaniu pojawia się sporo pływających drobinek chmielu. W aromacie naprawdę bardzo pięknie, intensywnie i chmielowo. Czuć tu po prostu świeży chmiel, zielone, pachnące, żywiczne szyszki wprost z krzaczków! Oczywiście owoce cytrusowe i tropikalne połączone z iglakami, bez cienia jakiegoś DMSu czy diacetylu - po prostu czysty, orzeźwiający, bogaty amerykański chmiel. Smak dość wytrawny, słodycz naprawdę nieduża, owocowo-słodowa, nadająca balansu chmielowej nawałnicy atakującej nasze kubki smakowe. Goryczka jest konkretna, ale strasznie przyjemna, krótkotrwała i czysto chmielowa, grejfrutowo-świerkowa - uderza z duża siłą, by po chwili ustąpić i zachęcić do kolejnych łyków. Nagazowanie średnie do niskiego, odczucie w ustach gładkie, smukłe. Alkohol w smaku kompletnie niewyczuwalny, ale wyraźnie rozgrzewa w przełyku. 
Świetne piwo. Idealny przykład stylu American IPA - bardzo pijalna, sesyjna, znika ze szkła zbyt szybko (byłaby zdradliwa przy większej ilości). Największą zaletą tego piwa jest jednak perfekcyjnie świeży i umiejętnie użyty amerykański chmiel - to tu tkwi tajemnica. Jednocześnie oznacza również, że szybko się starzeje, z każdym dniem byłoby tylko mniej intensywne... No i cena - 32zł to jednak zdecydowana przesada, idealnym zamiennikiem jest dla nas choćby Deep Love z AleBrowaru czy American IPA z Kormorana. Różnice są naprawdę nieduże, w zasadzie w niuansach (i to tylko dla beer geeków) i kwestiach marketingowo-prestiżowych - za jednego Focal Banger mielibyśmy 4 polskie świetne piwa! Inną sprawą jest jednak być wśród nielicznej grupy wybrańców, którym dane było spróbować tego "cudeńka", zwłaszcza w odległym kraju nad Wisłą...

lots of citruses, pine, tropical fruits (pinapple) and little floral, some malty notes; golden, little hazy, big falling to small white foam; high bitterness, lightly sweet and sour; medium body, crisp and little bit oily feel, average+ carbonation, long bitter finish;
Overall: great aroma, fantastic taste, high drinkability, fantastic beer
Can shared by Troy. Nose is super danky and tropical. Hazy orange color. Small white head. Moderately bitter. Hop flavor is tropical and just as danky as the nose. Yum a dum dum.
Can in trade. Pours light orange to yellow, white head. Aroma is citrusy, pretty awesome. Finishes super dry and hoppy. Easy drinking too, not I. Your face hops. Could drink all day.

Aroma: citrus, pine, pineapple, white grapes, 
Appearance: hazy golden color, thin white head.
Taste: high bitterness (pine, resin, grapefruit), refreshing hoppy notes, nice thin malty backbone, balanced, grapefruit with grapes.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, bitter finish.
Overall: Really amazing hoppy profile, refreshing, full of flavour, balanced. Perfect.

Hazy golden color with a large white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of floral hops, pine, tropical fruits, some toasty malts, and citrus. Taste of citrus, pine resin, grapefruit, grass, lightly bitter, dry finish.
Can from SJ. Bold hop notes, grapefruit, pine, caramel malts,and a grassy bitter finish. Nicely done.

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2016 Can from BA tasting. Hard to believe this thing was 3 months old when we opened it. Pours a slightly cloudy golden yellow with a white head. Big dank aroma with orangey citrus and mango. Taste is light bitterness but crazy smooth. Like I was drinking weed.

Arôme de pin, houblon résineux, pomélo, écorce de pamplemousse, malt pâle, oignon subtil. Goût de pomélo, houblon résineux, malt en support, amertume élevée et persistante. Carbonatation moyenne-élevée, corps moyen.

Can: Poured a clear light yellow color ale with a nice white foamy head with excellent retention and some great lacing. Aroma of huge floral notes of grass notes with some light resinous notes also perceptible. Taste is also dominated by an all-out hops assault with tons of grassy notes with light limey notes and some resinous hoppy notes. Residual sugar can be detected but doesnt stray the taste from the hoppy notes. Body is about average with great carbonation. Very enjoyable but almost close to being unbalanced with those sharp hoppy notes.

Can shared by a friend during the Christmas Movie Marathon on 12/20/14. Clear yellow in color with a thick white head. Aroma of pine, onion, malt, resin and grapefruit. Malty and piney flavor with some citrusy grapefruit before a dank onion finish.

Can from Steve, many thanks to you!

Has a glowing, hazy apricot orange color, with a decent, stable head.

Aromas are defined by a dank fruitiness of both, pineapples and lemon. Also bread, as well as papaya shine through less intense, together with honeyed malt qualities.

Begins well balanced, with resinous lemon among a distinct biscuity maltiness. Then a crisp, almost sharp, bitter lime hoppiness emerges on the palate, supported by grassy herbs. This brew has a very pronounced maltiness which blends flawlessly into the the hops, beginning with honeyed, biscuity notes, turning into a bready, earthy direction. Helps to bring out the hops, which start grassy and a bit resinous, heading into a more and more fruity direction, with a slick lime and orange ending. Drinks outstandingly smooth, with a bitter, incredibly hoppy finish.
Hazy yellow with medium head. Passion fruit, apricots, tropical fruit, mango aroma. Taste the same, with long bitter aftertaste. Great beer
What a nice fruity brew. So many different fruit tastes trough the hops. Just misses a small boost for me.

Bottle thnx to a customer of BelgiumInABox , shared with the other employees ! 
Pours hazy yellow, good white head . Smell is recognizable mosaic hops , but better than what Im used to from it . Fresh , slightly green and herbal . 
Taste is bitter , full, citrussy ( citra takes over in the taste ) Bitter finish , very nice and very refreshing .

Can at James for the multi-K tasting. Pours a clear gold with a thin white head. Citrus and musk, a bit of sweet candy. Medium bodied, malt and a bit of sweet candy, citrus. Hops have faded a bit, but still quite tasty and vibrant. Long grapefruit, lingering bitterness.

My Bottom Line:
This dank yet luminous IPA showcases citrus fruit galore enveloping earthy resins leading to a bitter and refreshing example.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A fveil of foam covers the hazy pale blond.
-The fluffy mouthfeel is as natural as can be.
-The aroma and hop flavor are both superb.
-Marijuana is also evoked by the hop profile.

Can.

Golden color unfiltered. aroma is dank, dank dank with some pineapple on the nose. the taste is immediate citrus and pine on the tongue, the middle is filled with some stone fruits and the back is loaded with orange peel and pine. This is a flavor bomb to be sure. Almost as good as heady. Maybe the best IPA ever.

Une canette qui a une semaine de vie. Corps embrouillé blond avec une mousse qui disparait en un clin dil. Gros nez de gazon et dherbe, de citron concentré et de miel. Saveurs houblonnées vibrantes de citron, de pamplemousse et dherbes malheureusement alourdies par une céréale beaucoup trop assez mielleuse. Un corps moyen-fort avec un bon pétillement et une texture huileuse. Une finale plus ou moins compatible avec moi : citron artificiel et pastilles au miel. Je ne suis pas étonné de sa position dans léchiquier des IPAs même si je trouve quelle est surévaluée. Pour moi, elle reste plus ou moins facile à boire à cause de sa finale et de sa lourdeur. Les arômes sont biens mais certainement pas renversants. La bouche est trop amère et en même temps, trop mielleuse. À reboire? La réponse est non. Mieux maitrisée, par contre, que sa petite sur des Trois Mousquetaires.

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2014 Pours yellow cloudy with a white head. Huge tropical fruit, peaches, pineapple. Taste is citra, grapefruit, a little bit sweet. Big bitter aftertaste, incredibly refreshing. Its up there with Heady Topper.

HUGE tropical fruit and peachy aromas. Creamy white head and creamy body. Cloudy nectarine colour. Taste is tropical fruits and pleasant grapefruit bitterness. This is smooth as heck, this could be drank all day if it werent 7%.

Blind IPA tasting -10 beers. This was #1 for all in the tasting...pretty impressive. Pour is cloudy gold with a medium white head. Aroma and flavor Are loaded With citrus hop, light malt, and a clean hop finish. So nice.

This poured a hazy light orange color with a white head. Aroma was big tropical fruits and not much else, why would anything else be needed? Flavor was similar, minimal bitterness, super juicy. Waaaaay better than heady.

Hazy yellow-orange color with small off white head. Bursting with aroma of citrusy hops. Medium body, light carbonation. Flavor matches aroma, citrus hops, malt structure but not too prominent in the flavor. Bitterness level just right. For the inevitable comparison to heady topper I would say its overall similar, less intense but more drinkable.
Can. Pours cloudy yellow gold with a big white head that lingers. Aroma of tropical fruit, grass. Flavor is lemony citrus, tropical fruit, grassy bitter in the finish. Very nice.

CAN at tasting.
APPEARANCE: clouded blond beer, small unstable white head.
NOSE: hoppy, citra, nice.
TASTE: hoppy, citra, nice, very balanced and fruity, quite florar.

Update 2017, now regular release. Aroma of tropical fruit, citrus, quite one noted, lightly floral. Taste of grapefruit, general tropical fruit, lychee. Too sweet. Thin mouthfeel. This was disappointing. 7-4-6-3-13

Little cloudy pale yellow to light beige beer, big creamy white head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: citrus, sourish, floral, bit earthy, pineapple, lemony, lemon drops. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: fruity start, lots of citrus, peaches, bit grassy, some alcohol, straightforward bitterness. Aftertaste: piny, lots of citrus, very grassy, bitter.

Sample at first sunday. Hot damn I love Alchemist IPAs. More subtle than heady but I think I prefer the subtley these days. Lemon and tangerine tropical fruit aromas and flavors. Later in the palate is a little more grassy and herbal again, slight citrus bitterness. Delicious.

500 ml. can sampled @ Pure Apricot Tasting. Thanks! Sampled side-by-side The Crusher / Heady Topper / Rapture / Focal Banger. Heady Topper came out last unanimously. Bit Heady Topper-light in a good way, this one tasted a bit like a mix of the previous 3 beers which seems logical since this one is Citra & Mosaic and The Crusher was Citra only I believe & Rapture was Mosaic, yeast is probably same as Heady Topper. Lighter hazy citrus, creamy white head. Huge cheese, citrus, creamy raw hop nose. Taste is cheese, light Heady Topper-like floral bitterness and touch of grass, creamy, dank, more balanced & bit subdued, fruity, pear, Creamy, very easy to drink, seems light compared to others but that is probably just the ABV. Better than Heady Topper but not on par with either The Crusher or my favourite Rapture.

Fresh can from trade with Matt. Pours yellow with some small particles floating around and with a white head. Aroma is just BOOMING with grapefruit, citrusy notes, ginger, unripe pineapple, mango and just a tiny bit of breadyness in the background. Taste of fresh and tropical citrus fruits. Just WOW! ginger, pineapple, mango, grapefruit and with a hint of mint in the aftertaste. Very bitter, crispy and freaking refreshing.

Can shared with rasmusott and Vestergaard. The feast is on! Pours a hazy (and dirty) yellow with a white medium head. Aromas of strong grapefruit, citrus. Slight ginger-like bitey notes. Some subtle bread and slight sour yoghurt. Taste in grape-bitter up front, some grassy fresh hops, tropical unripe pineapple, pretty minty and very grapefruit finish. Great great IPA.

Can from trade. Have to admit that i poured it into a glass. Fresh stuff. Pours yellow, hazy with a white head. Aroma has huge crispy grape fruit and citrus. Almost ginger-like bite. Fresh hoppy and exotic fruits. Taste has extremely minty fresh hops. Citrus, some pine, pear, grape fruit peel, unripe pineapple, A sweet winegum sweetness. Has a little bit hay or grains. Crazy crisp body, and pretty high carbonation. A very nice IPA!

Can from De Hopduvel. Shared with tderoeck and Erwin. Hazy cloudy yellow, white head. Aroma of tropical fruit, honey, hops. Light sweet with bitter dry finish. Extremely well balanced, easy drinkable. Very good!

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2014 50cl can, as Focal Banger, American brew, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex bitter brew, fruity/bitter and slightly floral/malty/woody, very balanced, cloudy, good head, very good brew, yet expensive!, Heady Toppers little brother, still very big!

From can. Hazy golden color with a white head. Strong aroma of resinous hops. Pine cone and lemon lime soda. Honeyed grass. A bit of compost pile dirt. Similar flavor. Sticky honeyed bread and a bit of graham cracker. Big, boisterous dank hops. Lemon and herb. Pine wood on the dry finish. Sort of sticky. Medium body, active carbonation. Yep, very nice.

Can from TheEpeeist, much thanks! Pours cloudy golden straw with a medium creamy off-white head that dissipates slowly with nice lacing. Aroma is strong cat piss, dank as shit, some stonefruit, passionfruit, grassy notes. Flavor is light sweet and light bitter, resinous and dank. Medium body, oily mouthfeel. Intangibles - check! But somehow an IPA with two of my favorite hops just doesnt come through for me in this case.

Can, tfs JulienHuxley! Hazy pale golden colour, white head. Aroma of citrus, mango, sweat, some pine, tropical stuff, light soapy, crisp malts. Flavour is full-on fresh citrus fruits and tropical fruits, crisp malts, hint of honey, firm bitter finish with some citrus, pine and grass. Light-bodied. Great.

Pours pale golden color with white head. Big citrus aroma with big, potent, dank, resiny pine. Flavor starts citrus followed by a sweet mango and tropical fruit flavor and finishing with a big grapefruit and resiny pine hop bitterness. Bitterness does not linger. Thanks dsandonato for this one!

16 oz can shared with JulienHuxley, Borresteijn & caesar @ Juliens Klein Maar Fijn tasting - tfs Julien! Hazy golden blonde color. Dense white head, short retention. Strong resinous aroma, with citrus as well. Resin, grassy hops and bitterness retronasal. Bitter flavor with a malty sweet backbone. Medium bodied. Finishes dry and long lasting bitter. Yeah baby!

Can thx to Julien @ Juliens neighbour is a metalhead according to Rob-tasting, small sample. Quite fresh sample. Hazy golden color, short head. Aroma is very resinous, pine, also some grapefruit, bit onion and garlic, some bready malt notes. Quite bitter in taste. More powerful than the Heady Topper we just had, but (unlike the others) I preferred the older Heady Topper.

Can. Hazy pale gold pour with creamy white head. Aroma is really dank, piney, resinous, dank sweaty hop, garlic, lemon, mango, just like fresh Heady as I remember it. Taste is hoppy, not really bitter, light piney flavor of course, but mostly just soft tropical hop notes with light bready malts. Palate is med bodied with light carbonation. Very easy drinking.
Smell and taste of citrus, malt, yeast/dough. Floral hops, juicy and quite crushable
16 oz can. Misty orange with a foamy white head. Nose is dough, citrus, mango and slight musk. Medium body, resiny with soft carb. Taste is mango, cat, pine and honey. Lovely.
Can. Pours gold with a white head. Dank piney and floral hops, with lighter citric fruity notes. Dangerously crushable. A little lighter than Heady Topper as well.

Hazy yellow color with a little head. Aromas of lemony and aromatic hops. Flavors of grapefruit, lemon, resinous hops and hop bitterness. Couleur jaune trouble avec un petit col de mousse. Arômes de houblons citronnés et aromatiques. Saveurs de pamplemousse, citron, houblons résineux et amertue de houblon.

Big hop aroma. Lasting head on yellow body, leaving a lace trail. Citra dominated taste, rounded out by subordinate tropical fruit. Fresh tasting, a good complement to the Heady Topper.
Can from Tom, thank you.

12th June 2014Tasting at Bruces pad. Thanks to Leighton. Lightly hazy gold beer, tiny pale cream colour head. Palate is smooth with good fine carbonation. Light airy malt, slightly sweet. Good floralness. Light and sweet tinned mango. Mellow pine. Hop spice. Airy finish with a light bitter linger. Really nicely joined up.
Beautiful tropical fruit and floral aroma and flavor to match. Reminds me of Heady Topper but less aggressive.

Liquide jaune-vert, effervescence en berne, nez floral et fruité au possible, bombe houblonnée en prévision. Mince et plutôt limpide. Un plaisir sans prétention, prévisible de la première à la dernière gorgée, mais ô combien délicieux.

Can split at Bruces pad, massive thanks to LKS - who knew this brewer produced a 2nd beer !?!, 12/06/14.
Hazed pale golden with a good sized off white head that retains well.
Nose is tangerine, juicy citrics, light pine jacket, peach, lemon rind, peach, grassy twinges.
Taste comprises dank hops, floral notes, melon, tangerine, pink grapefruit zing, grassy, orange pithdom.
Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, juicy hop squeeze in the close.
Solid IPA with earthy come dank hop twinges.

The taste is crisp, bitter, pine needles, grapefruit, tinned fruit, peppery, earth, dank, soap with a bitter citric finish. Medium body, fine carbonation and light mouth-feel. Crisp, light and very drinkable. Crussssshable......mmmmm....juicy....hop....yum = 3.9 September 2015 Update: had this again in Vermont and it was even better. 4.1

Can shared in London - picked up in a trade. Pours lightly unclear yellow-gold with a frothy, white head. The nose has lots of dank, pissy hop character, some lemon, faint grapefruit. Medium sweet flavor, some earthy hops, piney stickiness, some minerality, grass, melon, grapefruit. Medium bodied with fine, massaging carbonation. Nicely balanced finish, some oily hops, a bit of bitter grass, ripe melon, lemon, grapefruit. Absolutely lovely stuff. Extremely slam-able.
Can thanks to Will. Poues a cloudy yellow with small frothy white head. The aroma is strong citra and mosiac. Medium mouthfeel with strong citrus, and light dry hop with light bitterness. Very good.

Can from MrBarleywine, thanks for the hookup Mike!
Cloudy hazy lemon orange color with a huge frothy bubbly bone white head that persists forever. Citrusy tropical fruit lemony pine and resin dominate the aroma with just a bit of sweet bread deep underneath. The flavor holds a touch of lemon with lots more citrus and tropical flavors like the aroma suggested. Bread and light caramel maltiness bring in a hint of balance. Moderate level of hop bitterness with a lingering bite at the end of every sip. Medium body with a moderate level of carbonation and a resinous sweet watery mouthfeel. Quite easy to drink and very flavorful, its a great beer. I prefer the depth of flavors from Heady, but I could drink this one regularly with ease.

16oz can shared by JohnGonk. Pours a cloudy straw color with a small foamy white head. Aroma of pineapple, papaya, fresh orange and lemon citrus, and bready malts. Taste of pineapple, mango, papaya, orange and lemon zest, and bready malts. Tastes like a session version of heady! Good stuff!
Can shared by Collin. Clear yellow pour with a white head. Fruity hop aromas. Grapefruit hop notes dominate. Good balance, body, and mouthfeel. Very nice..

Amazing citrus aroma. This beer is top notch. Pours light golden yellow with a medium head. The taste is very crisp and refreshing with strong citrus hop character and a clean after taste. Not as hop forward as Heady Topper, but very crisp and clean. Amazing world class beer.

16oz can I got from dark lord day pours a hazy orange with a frothy white head. Orange mango hop taste. Great ipa.

MAJ : Une autre cannette : il y a définitivement aussi un goût doigons. Je ne trippe pas tant que ça sur le choix des houblons.

Can, thanks to blckout20! Appearance: Nice pale golden pour with thin white head. Aroma is very fruity (mango, banana, oranges), some light dank hops and some biscuit malts / graham crackers. Taste is fruity, moderate to high bitterness and a tad too sweet. Carbonation is rather low. Im being picky here as Im comparing it to HT. Not nearly as powerful and resinous as Heady, but a very good highly drinkable IPA.

Can. Pours murky orange with thin white head that lingers. Medium hop aroma over light carbonation. Some citrus flavor with pepper finish. Signature alchemist complexity in a superior ipa.

Bottle shared at the 5k/7k/11k. Another winner from the Alchemist. Aroma of grapefruit rind and fresh sliced pine needles. Pours amber with a sticky frothy head. Taste is wonderfully juicy with grapefruit zest, rick pine resin, and sticky juicy malt. Wonderfully intense but no bitter aftertaste. Would gladly get more of this and pass it around.
16oz can thanks to Toby. Pours out a light golden. Topped with a soap head. Nose is a nice mix of hops floral and citrus. Taste is a nice hop combo and a sweet malt.
labeled can at 7K/5K. Pours yellow gold with white head. Nose/taste of white sugar, citrus, wet grass and light malt. Medium bodied.

Fans at Cork with Paul in Waterbury. Delicious funky hop, mosaic, bright tropical notes and pineapple. Super juicy. Dad juice. +0.1
A little past its prime. Orange zest, grapefruit, some tropical fruits, some dankness. Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, assertive bitterness. Solid. Would like to try this fresh.

Citrus and pine mostly with a hint of tropical fruit. Taste is so oily and dank without being perfumy. Reminds me a lot of Heady. Grapefruit, mango, pine, pineapple, and fresh cut grass. Moderate bitterness and so smooth. Just awesome. Why are all the best IPAs and DIPAs from Vermont? I hope I can retire there.

Pours an orange hue with tons of sediment suspended in the liquid. Delicate white foam forms on the surface, leaving behind sticky cobwebs of lace. 

Soft, low carb level. Citric aroma is a bit faint, reminding me of what this moderately old (~1 month?) IPA likely once was. Clean malts beg me not to notice the aging hops behind them but alas, it's too late. Hints of tropical fruits fade quickly with each sip, dressing my palate in past-prime hoppy bitterness. Still a decent beer today, yet I can only imagine what this tasted like a few weeks ago. 

Regardless, it's no Heady.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2014 Can: Thanks, Mark! Cloudy orange-amber body with tiny bits of sediment floating about, topped with a wimpy, eggshell colored film & collar. Aroma is intense hoppage; dank hemp oil & weedy hops, fresh cut wet grass, tangerine zest, grapefruit flesh, very juicy & citric moreover with plenty of raw hop earthiness grinding through it all. Taste is crisp & delicious... A mouth full of wet pine, dankness, dripping lupulin oils, weed, grass, bitter grapefruit pith, light green onion, orange & tangerine peel, & the slightest kiss of sugar cookie malt sweetness in the finish. Aftertaste still leaves a lingering bitterness on the tongue. Truly delicious!

The aroma consists of moderate-heavy citrus, pineapple, and grapefruit. It pours a hazy dull orange with a lot of sediment. It had a small white head that quickly fades to a thin film outlined by a slightly thicker ring. The flavor starts with moderate citrus, pineapple, and tropical fruits. The finish has moderate grapefruit with a hint of pine. Its light-medium bodied with soft carbonation and mouthfeel.

Got this little gem from a friend. Pours a nice golden color with huge pine scent. Taste is of the same pine /citrus. Delicious beer one of the best ipas Ive had to date. 

I could go on and on but every really hit its strong points already.
Pours from a can a very hazy gold with a white head. Aroma is subtle orange and pine. Taste is straight grapefruit and pine with a little floral after taste. Leaves a bitter after taste.

Can thanks to Jason for sending me an enormous box of awesome for nothing. Pours a hazy glowing orange with fairly nice white head. The last of the pour definitely has Heady Topper lite levels of crap in it. How is this not a detriment to this and Heady Topper to more people? Aroma is peach, hay, orange and a slightly past its prime malt. Taste doesnt have any of that heavy malt. Nice tropical start with more orange in there and some stone fruit. Then it dies off and leaves a average to ho hum IPA. Overall, I am happy to have tried another beer from Alchemist and realize it isnt worth trading for.

Big can in a tulip. Pours hazy golden with a lacy, white head. Aroma of citrus, light fruit, and floral notes from the hops, pale and caramel malts, and some dough. Flavor the same with a cool blend. Average texture. A solid IPA.

Can with sticker label :) Mosaic & Citra - I like where this is headed. The pour is murky medium golden with some debris present as mentioned. I suppose you dont see that very often. Anyway - the head is whispy, two fingers, retention is average , with some light lacing present. The nose is dank, juicy fruit, tropicals, caramel, sourdough, meshing with some floral notes. Its very nice. The flavor profile is bittering initial, while it slowly moves to more distinct elements from the tropical side, like pineapple and grapefruit, while becoming more robust near the finish from caramelly undertones and more sweet bread here. There is a feint grassy, floral side present that gets rounded out by a long finish. For the IPA 7% range, this is fantastic imo.
Can. Golden orange with some floaters. Citrusy flavor and nose. OrAnge pith, grapefruit, very citrusy nice bitterness, fuller mouthfeel. Very nice
UPDATED: MAR 17, 2015 Citronnelle et fruits tropicaux entassés dans un liquide collant et astringent hyper aromatique avec un côté mielleux, buvabilité musclée.

Tasted from a 16oz can at a bottle share after the latest Jackie-Os bottle release. In a hotel room. Can had no label. Clear golden orange color. Lots of particles floating in the body. Thin off-white head, not much lace. Nothing impressive about the appearance. Awesome, big, citrusy resiny hop aroma, very impressive for 7%. A lot of caramel bready malt too. Hard to believe, really. Tastes like 8-9%. Not sure if this is a good or bad thing. More caramel malt sweetness than your typical IPA. Bigger body. Smooth, lighter carbonation. Kind foc risp. Bigger sweet, sweetness is like that of a DIPA. Kind of wierd, for what is supposed to be a regular IPA. Great big resiny hoppy aroma, though.
Can. Thanks chris. Not as good as heady topper I feel. This is more west coast which i like but it seems lacking all around.

16 oz. can shared by the Dayton crew at the Jackie-Os hotel bottle share. Thanks! Pours a clear gold color with a small white head. Wow, this one is so herbal and oily, especially on the nose, with pale and sweet malts, and a good dose of citrus fruits. Light-medium bodied, with moderate carbonation and a fresh, herbal, oily mouthfeel. Not surprised this one is from the Heady Topper guys. A nice IPA that really pops.

Can courtesy of vtafro! Poured half into a Dogfish Head IPA glass and drank half from the can. Pour was a pale gold with a one finger white head that clung to the glass nicely before breaking into soapy lacing. Aromas were of heavy orange/peach with some earth/pine. Very fresh smelling and inviting. Taste was not as luscious as the smell. A nice burst of floral hops but the malt bill seemed thin. The grapefruit bitterness arrives in the finish unchallenged and kind of leaves the back-end of this feeling bare. A good beer but not a great one. Glad to have tried it!

Can at the Triad bottle share at Foothills organized by Mike. Loads of tropical fruit in the nose and flavor. Mango and pineapple heavy notes. Slightly rustic, and the dryness smacks you at the end. Very tasty!
Orange-gold, frothy white head, nice lacing. Nose is onion, citrus, pine. Taste is citrus, piney hops, onion, hop resin. Oily mouthfeel that finishes dry.

Pour is reasonably hazed peachy gold with a tight white head. Nose is loads of citrus hops with grapefruit and peach. Taste follows the nose, loads citrus, peach and grapefruit. Very dry and clean, well carbonated and lighter body. A lot like a slightly lower alcohol heady with a bit more fruity punch but less bright hop flavor.

Well I had huge expectations and this was just ok. Im glad I didnt spend money on a case at the release. Aroma is bubblegum, Orangeglow cleaner, light scallion, and citrus zest. Taste is too sweet and odd with huge bubblegum and cleanser. The finish is nice tho with that dank citrus element of citra hops. Shits gettin homered.

Draft. Golden pour with white head. Aromas is citrus and grassy tones. A lighter bodied heady topper, but not lacking flavor with a touch less bite. Wow, can I drink this all day.

Taste is such an amazing lineup of dank resinous hops, like heady but less aggressive and more tropical. awesome stuff. Pours hazy golden with low white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of tropical fruits, citrus, resin. Taste is of tropical fruits, bitterness. Palate: Light-medium body. Overall: Very refreshing. Nice citrus. Awesome brew.

On tap @ Prohibition Pig (Waterbury). Hazy golden/orange with a medium white head and some lacing. Aroma is of citrus, resinous notes, grass, light malt and light alcohol. On tap at the brewpub. Poured a near clear gold with a white head that dissipated slowly to the edges and laced slightly. Aroma was full of grass, pine and a bit of resin with a nice sweet grain backbone. Flavor started with pine and grass with a growing note of resin that was balanced nicely by a grain backbone.

In short: A very intense, very aromatic, very bitter, fruity and grassy blonde IPA.  Wow!
How: Tap at brewpub
The look: Cloudy blonde body topped by a long-lasting small white head
In long: The strong mega-hoppy nose shows a lot of tropical fruits, lemongrass, grapefruits, front lawn grass.  An pleasant but unusual aroma for Simcoe/Chinook based IPA.  The beer is well malted but the bready honyed malts provide only a solid body are totally dominated by the intense hopping.  VERY intense hopping.  Grapefruits, tropical fruits, hops resin, grass juice.  Sensation of biting on a green hop pellet.  Sticky long-lasting bitterness.  This is a very tasty beer, very bitter, very sharp.  Almost too tasty to be sessionnable.  Yet another kick-ass hoppy beer from The Alchemist.  A strange beer name but theres a story behind it.  The brewer was talking to one of his friend about their friend Al (a real jerk) and his slutty wife.  He told his friend Fuck Al, Bang her! just as Al walked in Oh no, nothing, just talking about my new beer.  True story.

A ridiculous amount of hops in the aroma and flavor: tropical fruit/amarillo, grapefruit, pine, some simcoe possibly....resinous with a medium malt backbone.  Hops are completely in the forefront with some malt character just sneaking in here and there. Another awesome IIPA from John at the Alchemist!
